name: Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Jalapeño Poppers
description:
How big your jalapeños are will determine how much filling you need. You may have some leftover. You can use for a future batch or to stuff mushrooms or other delicious uses.  
If desired, you can use just a half slice of bacon per popper, but we prefer a whole slice. If using a half slice, you may need to stretch the bacon it get it to wrap around the popper nicely. 
All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food.

recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup grated cheddar cheese ( (or cheese of choice))
6-12 slices bacon (, depending on how much bacon you prefer)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the jalapeños in half, lengthwise. Scrape out the seeds and white ribs. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Jalapeños

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix together the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder and salt until smooth & evenly combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix filling

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the jalapeño halves with the cream cheese mix. If using 6 slices of bacon, cut them in half lengthwise. Wrap the bacon around the filled jalapeño poppers.
recipeInstructions.name: Fill Jalapeño halves

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle black pepper over the top of the wrapped jalapeño poppers. Lay in air fryer basket/tray in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 10-12 minutes, or until the bacon is crispy and the jalapeños are tender, or cook to your preferred doneness. Serve warm or at room temperature.

1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Trim the top & bottom off the acorn squash, and then cut the squash in half from top to bottom. Scoop out the seeds using a spoon. Lay the squash cut side down on the cutting board, and cut the squash into half rings, about 1/2-inch thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Trim the top & bottom off the acorn squash, and then cut the squash in half from top to bottom. Scoop out the seeds using a spoon. Lay the squash cut side down on the cutting board, and cut the squash into half rings, about 1/2-inch thick.

recipeInstructions.text: In a small bowl, combine the melted butter, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Toss the acorn squash rings in the butter mixture until well coated. Place in the air fryer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: In a small bowl, combine the melted butter, brown sugar, salt and pepper. Toss the acorn squash rings in the butter mixture until well coated. Place in the air fryer basket.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 375°F for about 15-20 minutes or until tender, flipping the squash after the first 10 minutes. Remember to flip so the squash cooks evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 375°F for about 15-20 minutes or until tender, flipping the squash after the first 10 minutes. Remember to flip so the squash cooks evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: You can make it extra delicious by drizzling the squash with extra melted butter, chopped nuts, and pomegranate seeds. Taste for seasoning and add a little more salt & pepper if desired.

name: Air Fryer Lasagna Egg Rolls
description: These are great with so many different dips to serve with: marinara, ranch and bbq sauce are delish! Choose your favorite or have several for variety. You can use leftover lasagna or cook up a batch to use just for the egg rolls. Just make sure to let the lasagna cool to at least room temperature before rolling the egg rolls. Makes about 15 egg rolls

video.name: Air Fryer Lasagna Egg Rolls with Time & Temp. - AIR FRIED FAIR FOOD FAVORITE!

recipeIngredient: oil spray (, for coating the egg rolls)
1/2-1 cup dipping sauce of choice (, marinara, ranch, bbq sauce, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the lasagna and then let cool to at least room temperature or use leftover lasagna. Cut into small slices about 2 Tablespoons in volume.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook & Portion Lasagna:

recipeInstructions.text: Using egg roll wrappers or spring roll wrappers, add the 2 Tablespoons piece of the lasagna filling to each wrapper. Add about 2 teaspoons of shredded cheese on top. Tuck and roll the wrapper around the filling (watch the video in the post above to see how to roll even and tight rolls). Brush the top corner of the wrapper with water to help seal the wrapper end, and then finish rolling the egg roll. Repeat for all the egg rolls.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll:

recipeInstructions.text: Brush or spray rolls with oil to coat. Place egg rolls in a single layer in the air fryer basket (cook in batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray:

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry 380°F for 12-16 minutes, flipping halfway through. Cook until the wrapper is crispy and browned. If you use the larger wrapper or if your wrappers are thicker cook a little longer so that all the layers can cook through to avoid being tough and chewy.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry:

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool a little (the filling will be super hot right after cooking), and then serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve:

description: Feel free to substitute whatever ground meat you prefer (pork, turkey, chicken, etc...). Or use the plant based "meats". You can always add more cheese if you want, although it may start to ooze out of the egg rolls when you cook them.

itemListElement.name: After the beef has cooled, stir in the cheese and optional diced pickles.

itemListElement.name: Using egg roll wrappers or spring roll wrappers, add about 1-2 Tablespoons of filling to each wrapper (depending on the size of the wrapper) Tuck and roll the wrapper around the filling.

name: Air Fryer Breaded Pork Chops
description: Not all pork chops are cut the same. There's so many different cuts. Adjust cooking time for thicker or thinner pork chops. Some brands of Air Fryers will cook slower or faster than others, adjust accordingly.We cooked the pork chops in a 3.4 qt. Air Fryer. For that size of air fryer, 3 pork chops is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. If you have a larger size, you can probably cook 2-3 more so long as they are still in a single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Add seasonings to both sides of the pork chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and smoked paprika.
recipeInstructions.name: Add seasonings to both sides of the pork chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and smoked paprika.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the breadcrumbs in a medium bowl. In another bowl, beat the egg.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the breadcrumbs in a medium bowl. In another bowl, beat the egg.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip each pork chop in egg and then dredge it in the breadcrumbs, coating completely. Lightly spray both sides of coated pork chops with cooking spray right before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip each pork chop in egg and then dredge it in the breadcrumbs, coating completely. Lightly spray both sides of coated pork chops with cooking spray right before cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F for 4 minutes. This will give the pork chops a nice crunchy crust.

recipeInstructions.text: Place in the Air Fryer and cook at 380°F (194°C) for 8-12 minutes. After 6 minutes of cooking, flip the pork chops and then continue cooking for the remainder of time or until golden and internal temperature reaches 145-160°F.

name: Air Fryer Crispy Breaded Broccoli Bites
description: Cooking times will vary depending on the size you cut broccoli and the size of your air fryer. Start on the lowest suggested time, then add more time if needed to your personal liking. One egg should be enough if you stir and soak the broccoli in the egg at the bottom of the bowl. But if you feel like you need more, then use 2 large eggs.

recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound fresh broccoli (, cut into bite sized pieces (about 2 cups))
1/2 cup bread crumbs ((Italian style or Japanese panko))
Optional Dips: hot sauce, ranch, bbq sauce, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat air fryer at 360°F for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Add broccoli to a bowl. Season with salt, pepper and garlic powder evenly over broccoli. Add beaten egg to the broccoli and stir to coat the broccoli.
recipeInstructions.name: Season broccoli and add egg

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl combine the bread crumbs and parmesan cheese  Dip broccoli in the bread crumb mix and shake off excess. Spray all sides of the breaded broccoli with oil spray. Dry breading might fly around in air fryer and burn, so make sure to coat any dry spots.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat broccoli in bread crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket or tray with oil and place broccoli in a single layer in the basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F for 5-8 minutes. Gently flip and spray any dry spots with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F for additional 3-5 minutes or until they are crispy golden brown OR to your preferred texture.  Serve warm with your favorite dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish air frying

name: Air Fryer Stuffed Turkey Breast “Roll” with Bacon, Spinach/Kale, & Parmesan
description: This recipe is based on two (1.5 pound) deboned turkey breasts. If not using bacon, replace with 2 Tablespoons oil or butter. Try to keep the skin-on turkey because it keeps the meat moist during cooking. Make sure to have a kitchen thermometer on hand to check temperature to ensure it’s cooked. See the great step-by-step photos in the write-up above recipe.You can easily halve the recipe for a single breast. We most often find the turkey breasst sold in packs of two, so the recipe is written for 2 breasts.

video.name: Air Fryer Stuffed Turkey Breast with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fried-stuffed-turkey-breast/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 2 1.5 lb. (680g) deboned turkey breasts salt , to taste black pepper , to taste FILLING: 4 slices bacon , cut into bite sized pieces 4 oz. mushrooms , sliced 1/2 small onion , diced 2 cloves garlic , minced 2 cups chopped fresh kale or spinach (if frozen use 1 cup, thawed, then squeeze out water) 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme , oregano or rosemary (or 1/2 Tablespoon fresh) 1/4 teaspoon dried sage or 1/2 tablespoon fresh chopped 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt , or to taste 1/4 teaspoon black pepper , or to taste 1/4 cup shredded parmesan cheese or crumbled feta INSTRUCTIONS MAKE THE FILLING: 1. Heat pan on medium-high heat and add bacon. Cook until bacon starts to become crispy. Add onion, garlic and mushrooms. Cook until mushrooms shrink and release moisture. 2. Add kale or spinach and cook until softened. Add dried herbs, salt and pepper and stir. Remove pan from heat. 3. Add the cheese and give it a good stir. Set filling aside. PREPARE THE TURKEY BREAST: 1. Place a sheet of plastic wrap on top of each turkey breast and pound thinner into an even thickness, about 1/2-inch thick. 2. Place the turkey breast skin side down. Lay the filling on top of turkey breast. Fold one edge of turkey breast over. Tie turkey breasts. Season top of tied breasts with additional salt and pepper. 3. Coat air fryer basket/tray with oil spray. Place the turkey breast on the basket/tray. 4. Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 20 minutes. Flip the stuffed breast over. 5. Continue to Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for another 10-20 minutes or until internal temperature of turkey reaches 165°F the thickest part. Allow to rest for 5 minutes and then slice and serve. ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fried-stuffed-turkey-breast/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

name: Air Fryer 2-Ingredient Sweet Potato Rolls: No Yeast
description:
These rolls are soft, tender and super easy to make. Make your own self rising flour by combining: 1 cup all-purpose flour, 2 teaspoons baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. This recipe makes 6 rolls that will cook all the way through. They're the perfect size for sliders. Don't make the rolls any larger because they might not cook all the way through and still be raw in the center.
Note: If cooking in an oven-style air fryer, try to put the 6 rolls all on the same tray for even cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine sweet potato and flour. Stir with a fork until a dough ball forms. Make sure to scrape all the flour and sweet potato along the sides of the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: In bowl, combine sweet potato and flour. Stir with a fork until a dough ball forms. Make sure to scrape all the flour and sweet potato along the sides of the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: On a lightly floured surface, knead the soft dough ball for about 1 minute, or until smooth. Don’t keep adding too much flour to the dough or else it will be tough and hard. You want to keep the dough soft and pliable, so don’t over-knead it.
recipeInstructions.name: On a lightly floured surface, knead the soft dough ball for about 1 minute, or until smooth. Don’t keep adding too much flour to the dough or else it will be tough and hard. You want to keep the dough soft and pliable, so don’t over-knead it.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the dough into 6 equal pieces. Roll the dough between your hands to form 6 balls.  Let the dough balls rest for about 30 minutes (they will also rise slightly).
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the dough into 6 equal pieces. Roll the dough between your hands to form 6 balls.  Let the dough balls rest for about 30 minutes (they will also rise slightly).

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket or tray with oil. Gently place dough balls in the basket, evenly spaced apart. Lightly spray the tops of the dough balls with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray air fryer basket or tray with oil. Gently place dough balls in the basket, evenly spaced apart. Lightly spray the tops of the dough balls with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for 10-14 minutes or until the rolls are cooked through. Allow to cool and serve with butter or as small slider or sandwich buns.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for 10-14 minutes or until the rolls are cooked through. Allow to cool and serve with butter or as small slider or sandwich buns.

name: Air Fryer Doritos Crusted Chicken Strips
description: Several factors will affect cooking time. Size of your cut chicken. Air Fryer size & style (basket, oven, etc.). How much coating you put on the chicken.  Keep checking to see if it’s cooked through. If you choose to make smaller nugget sizes, they will cook faster than the chicken strips.
recipeIngredient: 9 oz. Doritos ( or any flavor tortilla chips)
1 large egg (, beaten (or more if needed))
2 pounds chicken (, cut into thin strips)
For dipping: Ranch, sour cream, ketchup, bbq sauce or your favorite sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Crush the Doritos or tortilla chips in a bag with a rolling pin. Crush them thoroughly. The smaller the pieces, the better they'll coat the chicken. Place the crushed chips in a bowl for dredging the chicken. Put the beaten egg in another bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Crush Chips

recipeInstructions.text: Season the chicken strips with garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Working with one or two chicken strips at a time, first coat the chicken strips with the egg, then coat with the crushed Doritos. Gently press the chicken into the crushed chips, then pour chip pieces over the chicken strips. Gently press chips into chicken. This help chips to stay dry. If they’re wet, they stick less to the chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat your Air Fryer at 380°F (195°C) for 4 minutes. Spray the air fryer basket or racks with oil spray. Gently lay chicken pieces in the basket or on the racks in a single layer (cook in batches if needed). Spray oil spray on top of coated chicken.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F (195°C) for 15 minutes. Gently turn the chicken pieces and spray the tops with oil spray (make sure to turn the chicken gently or else the chip pieces will fall off).Air Fry for additional 3-5 minutes or until the crust is crispy golden brown and chicken is cooked through. Serve warm with your favorite dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken Strips, Crusted Chicken, Doritos

description: Keep checking and turning the pork belly pieces to make sure they are cooked to your preferred doneness. Everyone cuts their pork belly differently. We like our pieces extra crispy! Air Frying times will vary depending on the size of pork belly pieces and the size of your air fryer.

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. pork belly (, rinsed & patted dry)
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce ( or soy sauce)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the pork bites a really good sear.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the pork bites a really good sear.

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, remove the skin from the pork belly. Cut the pork belly into 3/4” sized cubes and place in a bowl. Season with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Spread the pork belly in even layer in air fryer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: If needed, remove the skin from the pork belly. Cut the pork belly into 3/4” sized cubes and place in a bowl. Season with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Spread the pork belly in even layer in air fryer basket.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the pork belly 2 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the pork belly, size & cooking intensity of your air fryer).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the pork belly 2 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the pork belly, size & cooking intensity of your air fryer).

recipeInstructions.text: If you want it more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time. Check the pork belly to see how well done it is cooked.
recipeInstructions.name: If you want it more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time. Check the pork belly to see how well done it is cooked.

recipeInstructions.text: Season with additional salt & pepper if desired. It needs a good amount of seasoning to bring out the flavors. Drizzle with optional bbq sauce if desired. Serve warm.

description: We recommend russet or gold varieties of potatoes for the jojos. They will cook to a softer, fluffy inside while crisping up nicely on the outside. Use whatever Shake ’n Bake style coating you prefer. Every brand has their own flavors and textures which appeal to different tastes.

recipeIngredient: 1 cup (about) Shake ’n Bake Style Seasoned Coating Mix (, or as needed)
Oil spray (, to coat the potatoes)
optional - Salt & pepper (, to your liking (some seasoned coatings are saltier than others and don’t need additional seasoning))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the potatoes into about 1/2-inch thick wedges. Try to keep the wedges about the same thickness so they’ll all air fry evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Place the seasoned coating in a shallow bowl or plate with a raised rim. Coat the potato wedges with oil spray and then press into the seasoned coating, gently packing to coat the potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat wedges

recipeInstructions.text: Place the potatoes in air fryer basket/tray and spread them into an even single layer (cook in batches if needed). Spray with a light coat of oil again.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in air fryer. Spray.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry potatoes at 380°F/195°C for 10 minutes. Gently turn the potatoes. Spray with oil spray if there are any dry spots.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Continue Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for another 8-12 minutes or until crispy. (smaller or shallower air fryers will often need the less time.) Season with additional salt and pepper if desired (some seasoned coatings are more flavorful than others). Serve hot with your favorite condiments (ketchup, mustard, ranch, bbq sauce, etc.)
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and finish cooking

name: Air Fryer Stuffed Zucchini Boats with Sausage
description: You can use ground turkey, chicken or beef. The possibilities are endless. For low-carb/keto, replace the breadcrumbs with any low-carb breading of choice (crushed pork rinds, almond flour, etc - and use a low-carb marinara sauce if serving with a sauce). Want a lot of meat filling? Then Pre-cooking the filling ensures that the sausage or any meat is fully cooked. If you're not adding a lot of filling then the raw meat should be cooked when the zucchini is cooked.If you like your zucchini extra soft, you can air fry just the cored out zucchini for about 5 minutes before adding the sausage and other fillings.
recipeIngredient: serve with your favorite tomato sauce or marinara sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Halve and core the zucchini.
recipeInstructions.name: Core zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: Lay zucchini cut-side down and spray skin side with olive oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the zucchini and stuff the center with sausage. Top with breadcrumbs and cheese. Spray tops with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Stuff Zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: Lay zucchini in air fryer making sure the zucchini doesn’t tip over (see note below).
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F for 10-14 minutes or until sausage is cooked all the way through. Serve with sauce if you want. Top with parsley. It’s delicious either way!
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Sausage, Stuffed, Zucchini

name: Air Fryer Pork Tenderloin with Carrots, Potatoes and Onion Gravy
description: This satisfying and hearty meal is perfect for weekend uppers with the family. The gravy and cooked veggies makes this meal another family favorite! This is for a pork tenderloin, not a pork loin. Tenderloins are thinner and cook quicker. If using pork loin instead of pork tenderloin, it is thicker than a pork tenderloin and will take longer to cook. Cut several 1/2" slits through the pork loin fatty side to help it cook through evenly.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 lb. potatoes (, cut into bite-sized pieces)

recipeInstructions.text: In large bowl combine oil, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, dried herbs, salt and pepper. Whisk ingredients together. Add tenderloin, potatoes and carrots. Stir to coat everything with marinade.
recipeInstructions.name: Make marinade

recipeInstructions.text: Lay tenderloin, potatoes and carrots in air fryer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 370°F/190°C for 15 minutes. Flip the tenderloin and stir the vegetables.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry and flip

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry for another 10-15 minutes, or to your preferred doneness or until center temperature reaches 145-160°F (63-71°C). It is best to use an instant read thermometer to check the tenderloin's doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish air frying

recipeInstructions.text: WHILE PORK IS COOKING, MAKE THE GRAVY: Heat large skillet on medium heat. Melt the butter and add onions. Cook onions until golden and caramelized, about 5 minutes. Stir onions often so they don’t burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Make gravy

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together flour and broth until well combined. Pour the mixture into the pan. Add Worcestershire sauce and salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk in flour and water.

recipeInstructions.text: Reduce heat to Low, stirring often, and simmer until thickened, about 5 minutes depending on your preferred thickness. When pork and vegetables are finished cooking, transfer to a platter and cover. Let rest for 5 minutes. Serve warm with gravy on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Thicken gravy

keywords: Air Fryer, Onion Gravy, Pork Tenderloin

name: Air Fryer Italian Pork Chops Parmigiana
description: We cooked the pork chops in a 3.7 qt. Air Fryer. For that size of air fryer, 3 pork chops is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. If you have a larger size, you can probably cook 2-3 more so long as they are still in a single layer. Adjust cooking time for thicker or thinner pork chops. Some brands of Air Fryers will cook slower or faster than others, adjust accordingly.

recipeIngredient: 3 (6 oz.) pork chops (, rinsed & patted dry)
2 Tablespoons chopped Italian parsley (, plus more for optional garnish)
Cooking spray (, for coating the pork chops)

recipeInstructions.text: Season the pork chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and smoked paprika.
recipeInstructions.name: Season the pork chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and smoked paprika.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and chopped parsley in a bowl. In a separate bowl, beat the egg.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix together the breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, and chopped parsley in a bowl. In a separate bowl, beat the egg.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip each pork chop in egg and then dredge it in the breadcrumb mixture, coating completely. Lightly spray both sides of coated pork chops with cooking spray right before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Dip each pork chop in egg and then dredge it in the breadcrumb mixture, coating completely. Lightly spray both sides of coated pork chops with cooking spray right before cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F for 4 minutes. This will give the breaded pork chops a great sear.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F for 4 minutes. This will give the breaded pork chops a great sear.

recipeInstructions.text: Lay pork chops in Air Fryer and cook at 380°F (194°C) for 8-12 minutes. After 6 minutes of cooking, flip the pork chops and then continue cooking for the remainder of time or until golden and internal temperature reaches 145-160°F.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay pork chops in Air Fryer and cook at 380°F (194°C) for 8-12 minutes. After 6 minutes of cooking, flip the pork chops and then continue cooking for the remainder of time or until golden and internal temperature reaches 145-160°F.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with cheese and air fry for 2 more minutes to melt the cheese. Serve warm with marinara sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with cheese and air fry for 2 more minutes to melt the cheese. Serve warm with marinara sauce.

name: Air Fryer Shredded Hash Brown Breakfast Casserole with Bacon
description: This classic breakfast casserole is perfect for small portions for the air fryer. If you’re serving a big crowd, the traditional oven still is best. But for 2 servings, air frying is great! For a vegetarian option, leave out the bacon and add some chopped spinach or kale.
recipeIngredient: 1 cup shredded hash browns (, lightly packed)
3 slices bacon (, cut into bite sized pieces)

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the base of 6-8” accessory baking pan with oil spray. Spread hash browns in a single layer and spray with oil evenly over the hash browns. Divide the pieces of raw bacon on top of the hash browns. Place the filled baking pan in the air fryer basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Put just hash browns and uncooked bacon in pan

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 10 minutes. Stir the mixture and continue Air Frying at 380°F/195°C for 2-3 minutes until the potatoes are cooked and bacon is crisp.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry hash browns and bacon

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl combine eggs, milk, cheese, bell pepper, salt, and pepper. After the hash browns and bacon are crisped, pour egg mixture into the hash brown pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine egg mixture and add to hash browns

recipeInstructions.text: Lower temperature and Air Fry at 320°F/160°C for about 12-15 minutes or until the eggs are set.
recipeInstructions.name: Lower temp and air fry

recipeInstructions.text: If eggs are not completely set, then turn off the air fryer. Pierce a fork a few times in the center of the casserole and leave the casserole in the hot air fryer for about 5 minutes. This will help the eggs set without burning the top. Allow to cool slightly and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Leave in air fryer for 5 minites if needed to finish

name: Air Fryer Ham with Pineapple Glaze
description: This recipe is for a slightly sweet glaze. If you add more brown sugar, it’ll thicken quicker.  Bring the ham to room temp before air frying. Otherwise the ham may still be too cold in the center after cooking. Our 3 pound boneless ham was cooked in a 6qt. Air fryer. For other sized hams and air fryers, adjust cooking times as needed. We estimate about 15-20 minutes per pound for air frying the ham.Don't let the foil touch the heating elements of the air fryer. If it touches, then your ham is too large for your air fryer. Trim down the bottom of the ham so it isn't too tall.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup brown sugar (, or to taste)
Optional - ((a few maraschino cherries or cranberries for garnish))

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the ham from the fridge and allow to come up to room temperature, about 2 hours before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring ham to room temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Glaze: Add pineapple juice, brown sugar, cinnamon, optional ground cloves and salt to pan. Simmer on medium-low heat for about 20 minutes or until is reduced to about half or until it starts to thicken a bit. Remove from heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Make pineapple glaze

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, remove the netting from the ham. If ham is not pre-sliced, score the ham with shallow 3/4-inch criss-cross cuts.
recipeInstructions.name: Score ham

recipeInstructions.text: For Basket Style Air Fryers: Line the air fryer basket with 2 pieces of long, criss-crossed foil sheets. Lay the ham on top of the foil and then brush with some of the glaze to coat the ham. Close the foil over the ham and wrap tightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: For Oven Style Air Fryers: Place the ham in an 8”x8” baking pan which fits in your air fryer (you may need to trim the edges of the ham to fit your pan and air fryer size). Brush with some of the glaze and close foil over the ham, wrapping tightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in baking dish

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 25 minutes. Open the foil and brush the ham with more glaze (make sure to reserve some glaze for finishing & serving).
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Close the foil tightly, and Air Fry again at 340°/170°C for 25 minutes. After air frying for the 50 minutes, open up the foil again and now push the foil down around the edges of the ham if using the basket-style air fryer method. Create a boat with the foil that holds the juices and keeps the hand from drying out. If using the Oven Style Air Fryer method, just remove the foil from the 8"x8" pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Glaze and continue cooking

recipeInstructions.text: Add the slices of pineapple on the top of the ham. Spread more glaze over everything.
recipeInstructions.name: Add pineapple

recipeInstructions.text: Increase heat to Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for about 5 minutes, or until caramelized to your liking. Let ham rest for 5 minutes before serving. Place the the maraschino cherries or cranberries in the center of the pineapple rings for optional garnish.
recipeInstructions.name: Caramelize

recipeInstructions.text: Optional serving: Combine the juices from the air fryer basket and the remaining glaze in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer and cook for a couple minutes or until slightly thickened. Brush the glaze onto the ham when serving or serve in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Easter, Ham, Holiday, Pineapple Glaze, Thanksgiving

Since the tater tots are already cooked, we like using pre-cooked sausage. The timing works better when the tater tots and pre-cooked sausage just needs to be heated up. Add some hot sauce, chopped avocado and a side of salsa for a breakfast “Totchos”.

recipeIngredient: 24  frozen tater tots (, (potato puffs) approximately (about 1/2 pound-227g))
4-5 inches kielbasa or pre-cooked sausage link (, sliced 1/2-inch thick and cut into half moons (about 1/4 lb.(113g) worth))

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the base of 6-8” accessory baking pan with oil spray. Spread tater tots in an even layer and spray with oil.

name: Air Fryer Hard "Boiled" Eggs Recipe
description: Read our tips in the website writeup. First time air frying eggs? Don’t do a huge batch at once! All air fryers, especially different sizes, cook slightly differently. Cook a test batch first of maybe 1-2 eggs. It’s trial and error at first and after that, you’ll know exactly what the best time and temp is in your air fryer model and the size of your eggs. Air Fry timing is for large eggs. If you’re using small, medium or jumbo eggs, adjust your time! Also, please read all our tips on the recipe write up page. Also, also, it’s easy to make a mistake and set the temperature too high! Make sure it’s at 270°F and NOT 370°F.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently place raw eggs in air fryer basket or air fryer rack. Air fry at 270°F for 15-18 minutes. Set your timer! While eggs are cooking, fill a bowl with ice water.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently place raw eggs in air fryer basket or air fryer rack. Air fry at 270°F for 15-18 minutes. Set your timer! While eggs are cooking, fill a bowl with ice water.

recipeInstructions.text: When eggs are finished, immediately place them in the ice bath for about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: When eggs are finished, immediately place them in the ice bath for about 5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Peel the eggs. If it’s hard peeling, try peeling them under water.

name: Air Fryer Crispy Fish Fillets (Homemade)
description: There are so many options for the breading that come out crispy and accommodate different dietary choices. We love them all, each giving slightly different texture and flavor. Lots of factors influence how the fish filets cook. They all vary in size and thickness, so you’ll have to adjust timing. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. Make sure to spray the filets to completely coat all the dry spots of breading or else it may cook up dry and crunchy instead of crispy. Want to know what oils and sprayers are best for an air fryer? This article is a great write up.

video.name: Air Fryer Homemade Fish Fillets with Time & Temp.

Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-fish-fillets/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 pound white fish fillets ((cod, halibut, tilapia, etc.))
1 teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
1/2 teaspoon black pepper (, or to taste)
1-2 cups breading of choice (breadcrumbs, panko, crushed pork rinds or almond flour)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F/193°C for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: If using frozen filets, make sure to thaw first. Cut fish filets in half if needed. Make sure they are even sized so they’ll cook evenly. The thicker they are, the longer they will take to cook. Pat the filets dry. Lightly oil the filets and then season with the salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Fish Fillets

recipeInstructions.text: Put the breading in a shallow bowl. In another bowl, beat the eggs. Dip the filets in the egg, shaking off excess egg. Dredge the filets in your breading of choice. Press filets into the bowl of breading so that they completely coat the filets. Repeat this process for all fish pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Bread Fish Fillets

recipeInstructions.text: Line air fryer basket or tray with perforated parchment paper or perforated silicone mat (highly recommended - if you don't have perforated parchment paper or mat, make sure to generously coat the air fryer basket with oil spray). Lightly spray parchment paper with oil spray.  Lay coated fish in a single layer on the parchment (cook in batches if needed). Generously spray all sides of the breaded filets with oil spray to coat any dry spots.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay on parchemnt

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 8-14 minutes, depending on the size and thickness of your filets. After 6 minutes, flip the filets. Lightly spray any dry spots than then continue cooking for the remaining time or until they are crispy brown and the fish is cooked through. Serve with your favorite dip: tartar sauce, mustard, aioli, etc.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Crusted Fish, Fish, Seafood

name: Air Fryer Cheeseburger Dumplings/Potstickers
description: Feel free to substitute whatever ground meat you prefer (pork, turkey, chicken, etc...). Or use the plant based "meats". You can always add more cheese if you want, although it may start to ooze out of the egg rolls when you cook them. There are many different shapes you can fold your pot stickers. You can do a simple half moon shape or get creative and try some more complex shapes.
recipeIngredient: 1/2  teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
1 1/2 cups grated cheese (, whatever you prefer - Cheddar, swiss, blue cheese, etc.)
10 slices pickles (optional) (, diced (dill or sweet depending on preference))
oil or oil spray (, for coating rolls)
ketchup, mustard, &/or bbq sauce (, for dipping )

itemListElement.text: Cook the filling: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil and then add the onion Cook for about 1-2 minutes or until softened. Add the ground beef, garlic powder, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until the beef is browned and cooked through. Remove from heat and allow to cool.
itemListElement.name: Cook the filling: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil and then add the onion Cook for about 1-2 minutes or until softened. Add the ground beef, garlic powder, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Cook for 3-4 minutes or until the beef is browned and cooked through. Remove from heat and allow to cool.

itemListElement.text: After the beef has cooled, stir in the cheese and optional diced pickles.
itemListElement.name: After the beef has cooled, stir in the cheese and optional diced pickles.

recipeInstructions.name: How to Roll and Air Fry

itemListElement.text: Using dumpling wrappers, add about 2 teaspoons of filling in middle of each dumpling wrapper. Dip your finger in water, then spread over edge of wrapper. Gently fold the dumpling in half and press on the edges to seal the dumpling. Gently press out any excess air and flatten the dumpling as you seal it.
itemListElement.name: Using dumpling wrappers, add about 2 teaspoons of filling in middle of each dumpling wrapper. Dip your finger in water, then spread over edge of wrapper. Gently fold the dumpling in half and press on the edges to seal the dumpling. Gently press out any excess air and flatten the dumpling as you seal it.

itemListElement.text: Brush the top corner of the wrapper with water to help seal the wrapper end, and then finish rolling the dumpling. Repeat for all the dumplings. Brush or spray with oil to coat.
itemListElement.name: Brush the top corner of the wrapper with water to help seal the wrapper end, and then finish rolling the dumpling. Repeat for all the dumplings. Brush or spray with oil to coat.

itemListElement.text: Place the dumplings in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Try not to have them overlap or touch if possible.
itemListElement.name: Place the dumplings in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Try not to have them overlap or touch if possible.

itemListElement.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for about 8-10 minutes, flipping halfway through. Cook until the wrapper is crispy and browned. If you use the larger wrapper cook a little longer so that all the layers can cook through to avoid being tough and chewy.
itemListElement.name: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for about 8-10 minutes, flipping halfway through. Cook until the wrapper is crispy and browned. If you use the larger wrapper cook a little longer so that all the layers can cook through to avoid being tough and chewy.

itemListElement.text: Serve warm with ketchup, mustard, bbq for dipping.
itemListElement.name: Serve warm with ketchup, mustard, bbq for dipping.

name: Air Fryer Amazing Burgers
description: Cooking time will vary depending on how thick your patties are. Air fry at the lowest timing we suggested and check the burgers. Continue cooking the patties to your preferred doneness. 80/20 is a good ratio for the beef/fat and will result in juicier burgers. Leaner ground beef for burgers will cook more dry but they won’t shrink as much. Fattier ground beef has more flavor but will shrink more.

recipeIngredient: 1 Tablespoon Worcestershire (, fish sauce, or soy sauce (fish sauce is our favorite))
4  Buns (, +  optional cheese, pickles, lettuce, onion, tomato, avocado, cooked bacon etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F/193°C for about 4-5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine beef, garlic, garlic powder Worcestershire sauce (or sauce of choice), salt and pepper. Mix everything until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix beef

recipeInstructions.text: Divide and flatten into 4 patties about 4” wide (don't pack the patties too firmly or else you'll have a dense burger - form just enough so that the patty holds its shape). Spray both sides with oil and spray the air fryer basket. If you have a smaller air fryer, you’ll might need to cook in two batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Make patties

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for about 8-12 minutes, flip after 6 minutes. Cook to your preference or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F/71°C. Timing will vary depending on thickness of patties and individual air fryer model.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: For Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: For Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: For best juiciness, cover the patties and let rest for about 3 minutes. While patties are resting, warm the buns in the air fryer at 380°F/193°C for about 1 minute. Serve on buns, topped with your favorite burger toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat buns

recipeInstructions.text: Layer cheese in between bread. Butter outside of bread with butter. Lay sandwich in air fryer basket. name: Air Fryer Frozen Turkey Burgers
description: Timing will be most determined by how thick the turkey patties are. Depending on your air fryer and cooked preference, you might need to add a little time for thicker patties, or a little less of thin patties. Some frozen patties come pre-seasoned, while others are not. Season to taste if needed. You don't need to thaw the turkey patties before air frying. Do not preheat the air fryer before cooking the frozen patties.

recipeIngredient: 4  frozen raw turkey patties (, usually sold as either 1/4 lb.(113g) or 1/3 lb.(150g))
4  Buns (, +  optional cheese, pickles, lettuce, onion, tomato, avocado, cooked bacon etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Spray both sides of frozen turkey patties with oil. Season with optional salt and pepper. Spray the air fryer basket with oil.  Place the patties in the basket in a single layer. Cook in batches if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep patties

recipeInstructions.text: 1/4 lb. frozen turkey patties: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for a total of about 12-17 minutes. After the first 10 minutes flip the patties and continue Air Frying at 380°F/193°C for another 2-7 minutes or until it’s cooked to your preferred doneness. The internal temperature should be 165°F/74°C.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: 1/3 lb. frozen turkey patties: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for a total of about 13-18 minutes. After the first 10 minutes flip the patties and continue Air Frying at 380°F/193°C for another 3-8 minutes or until it’s cooked to your preferred doneness. The internal temperature should be 165°F/74°C.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the patties and let rest for 3 minutes. Warm the buns in the air fryer at 380°F/193°C for about 3 minutes while patties are resting. Serve on buns, topped with your favorite burger toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Frozen Waffle Cut Fries
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how the waffle fries cook. They all vary in size,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. For smaller air fryers (less than 5qt.) 1 pound is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. The more you fill the basket the more frequently you’ll want to shake the basket to help them cook evenly. If you have a larger air fryer, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch of fries, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These  were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

name: Air Fryer Frozen Veggie Tots
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how the veggie tots cook. They all vary in size, vegetable type,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. If you have a larger air fryer, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen orange chicken in the air fryer basket and spread out into a single even layer. No oil spray is needed. Set the sauce, vegetables, and peanuts aside (do not sauce the chicken yet).

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen fries in air fryer basket and spread them evenly over the basket. If you have a large air fryer, you can cook a whole bag at a time. recipeInstructions.text: Air fry the frozen fries at 400°F/205°C for about 12-17 minutes. About halfway through cooking, shake the basket and gently turn the fries. Try not to break them. For crisper, evenly cooked fries, turn them multiples times while cooking.

name: Air Fryer Breakfast Sandwiches
description: There are several factors which influence outcome of how frozen breakfast sandwiches cook. They all vary in size, thickness, bread type, and the filling so you’ll have to adjust timing. In order to cook the sandwich all the way through the middle, you'll start by cooking the sandwich opened  up in halves, then finish the last couple minutes assembled.For best and even cooking, don't cook too many at once and overcrowd the basket.  Once you cook your first sandwich, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will depend on individual sandwich.

name: Air Fryer Reheating Leftover Pizza
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how the pizza reheats. Pizza slices varies so much in size and thickness, so you’ll have to adjust timing. All air fryers are different sizes and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first slice or two, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of your slice. Air fry for about 3 mintues first for 1 slice and add additional minute until it's reheated to your liking. Read our write up discussing the use of perforated parchment sheet or foil to keep the melted cheese on the pizza from sticking to your air fryer basket, try or rack.
recipeIngredient: oil spray (, (optional to lightly coat the pizza so toppings don't dry out - need depends on yoout particular toppings))

recipeInstructions.text: Place foil or perforated parchment sheet to base on air fryer basket, rack or tray. Place the pizza on top. If needed, lightly spray the top of pizza so that the toppings don't burn or dry out (optional).
recipeInstructions.name: Line air fryer with perforated parchment or foil

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 3-6 minutes or until cooked to your desired crispness. If unsure, start cooking for 3 minutes first. Then check to see if it's to your liking. Cook additional minute or two if you want the pizza to be crispier. Deep dish crusts will take a little longer, while thin crust will be slightly quicker.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the slice of pizza cool for a touch & enjoy!

name: Air Fryer Trader Joe’s Frozen Mandarin Orange Chicken
description: Trader Joe's Frozen Mandarin Orange Chicken has a cult like fan base and for good reason. It is quick, easy and delicious. In the air fryer, it is even more so. The chicken can be cooked in the air fryer straight from the freezer, no need to thaw. Just remove the sauce, air fry the chicken, and heat the sauce in the microwave or stove top while the chicken cooks. For a little added deliciousness, add a handful of chopped cilantro and/or green onion to sprinkle on when eating.

For best and even cooking, don't overcrowd the basket. Fill just an even single layer. Cook in batches if needed.All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary depending on individual taquito types.

name: Air Fryer Frozen Tater Tots (Puffs)
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how the tots or puffs cook. They all vary in size,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. For smaller air fryers (less than 5qt.) 1 pound is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. The more you fill the basket the more frequently you’ll want to shake the basket to help them cook evenly. If you have a larger air fryer, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These  were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the broccoli with oil. Season broccoli with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add the broccoli to the air fryer basket or rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat the broccoli with oil. Season broccoli with garlic powder, salt and pepper. Add the broccoli to the air fryer basket or rack.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry 380°F for 10-12 minutes, flipping and shaking 3 times through cooking. This will ensure that the broccoli cooks evenly. Start on the lower cooking time first (about 10 minutes) and if you like your broccoli more crispy, add additional time.

Only cook a single layer's worth at time for even cooking. Cook in multiple batches if needed. Do not thaw before air frying. With Cheese: If your garlic bread has cheese, you don't need to flip it or else the cheese will stick to the basket/racks. Just add additional minute or two to get to your preferred texture. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary depending on individual brands.

name: Air Fryer Frozen Pizza Rolls
description: There are several factors to timing of cooking the pizza rolls. They all vary in size and filling, so you’ll have to adjust timing. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food.   If your filling is exploding everywhere, you probably overcooked them a bit. Try reducing either time or temperature a little next time. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. These recipes were tested on basket style air fryers. Serving size is about 6 rolls.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pizza rolls in the air fryer basket and spread out in to a single even layer. Don't overcrowd the basket or else they won't cook evenly. No oil spray is needed.

recipeInstructions.text: For Regular Sized Pizza Rolls: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 6-10 minutes or until golden and nearly starting to ooze their filling. Shake and flip over about halfway through cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: For Mini Sized Pizza Rolls: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 5-8 minutes or until golden and nearly starting to ooze their filling. Shake and flip over about halfway through cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: For Mini Sized Pizza Rolls: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 5-8 minutes or until golden and nearly starting to ooze their filling. Shake and flip over about halfway through cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Let them rest for a couple minutes to cool off so the filling isn't dangerously hot. Be careful with that first bite!

name: Air Fryer Frozen Texas Toast (with cheese or without)
description: Different brands of frozen texas toast all vary in thickness, & cheese or garlic options so you’ll have to adjust timing. Only cook a single layer's worth at time for even cooking. Cook in multiple batches if needed. Do not thaw before air frying. For non-cheese Texas toast, we find it best to flip about halfway through cooking. For the cheese versions, you don't want to flip or else you'll lose your cheese.All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary depending on individual brands. Nutrition is based on Cheese Texas Toast.

name: Air Fryer Frozen Corn Dogs
description: There are several factors which influence outcome of how frozen corn dogs cook. They all vary in size, thickness, and the coating (some will have more honey or maybe some sugar in the coating) so you’ll have to adjust timing. For best and even cooking, don't overcrowd the basket. Fill just an even single layer of corn dogs (especially for the mini corn dogs). All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch of corn dogs, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition serving is based off of one regular corn dog will vary from brand to brand and will depend on the type of coating.

name: Air Fryer Frozen French Fries
description: Frozen frizes have different thicknesses. Adjust cooking time for thicker or thinner fries. Some brands of Air Fryers will cook slower or faster than others, adjust accordingly.We cooked the fries in a 3.4 qt. Air Fryer. For that size of air fryer, 1 pound is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer, and the more you fill the basket the more frequently you’ll want to shake the basket to help them cook evenly. If you have  larger size, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full.

name: Air Fryer Mexican Street Corn (Elotes)
description: You can use sour cream instead of Mexican crema if you can't find it. Instead of Mexican Cotija cheese, you can use a some feta or even parmesan cheese as easy substitutes.

video.name: Air Fryer Mexican Street Corn Elotes with Time & Temp.
video.description:
Full Recipe Here 👉 https://airfryerworld.com/air-fried-mexican-corn-elotes/

——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— 
Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py  

INGREDIENTS
4 ears corn , husked
2 Tablespoons butter , melted (approximately)
Kosher salt , to taste
black pepper , to taste

FOR CHEESE MIXTURE
1/3 cup Mexican cream or sour cream
1/4 cup mayonnaise
1/2 cup finely crumbled cotija (or parmesan cheese or feta cheese) plus more for serving
1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika
1/2 teaspoon chili powder , plus more for serving
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro leaves , and extra for garnish (optional)
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt , or to taste
fresh cracked black pepper , to taste
2 stalks green onions , sliced thin
1 lime , cut into wedges

🖨 Print Full Recipe Here 👉 https://airfryerworld.com/air-fried-mexican-corn-elotes/

👉—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——👈💜

⌲Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD
⌲Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup finely crumbled cotija ((or parmesan cheese or feta cheese) plus more for serving)
1/2 teaspoon chili powder (, plus more for serving)
1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro leaves (, and extra for garnish (optional))
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
fresh cracked black pepper (, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the corn to the size of your air fryer basket or rack (some might need to be cut in half).  Coat the corn with melted butter and season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Corn

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 370°F (190°C) for about 12-16 minutes, turning the corn half way through cooking. Cook until kernels are tender and lightly browned. (Cooking time will depend on size of corn, how full air fryer basket is, & different models/sizes of air fryers).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: While the corn air frys, make the cheese mixture. In a bowl combine sour cream, mayonnaise, cheese, smoked paprika, chili powder, garlic powder, cilantro, salt and pepper in a large bowl. Mix until evenly combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: After corn is cooked, spread the cheese mixture over the corn. Sprinkle with extra crumbled cheese, paprika or chili powder, green onions and/or chopped cilantro. Serve with lime wedges.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat Corn

name: Air Fryer Corn on the Cob
description: If you add the melted butter to cook the corn, the butter might burn. That's why we suggest using light spray of oil first, then add the butter right before eating. That way, you can taste the butter more!We start with fresh corn and haven't tried frozen corn on the cob. If you want to cook them from frozen, it might take the same amount of time.

name: Air Fryer Party Snack Mix - “Nuts & Bolts”
description: We’re obsessed with these and have to limit ourselves to one batch for every 2-3 days. It’s so easy to devour a batch in one sitting. This snack mix is customizable to your favorite ingredients so have fun with a new experiment every time you’re ready to air fry a new batch. For larger air fryers you can make a slightly larger batch. In our 6qt. air fryers we'll make about 3 cups worth of cereal (increasing all the ingredients in an equal ratio). Don't try to make too much at a time or else the air won't flow through properly and the mix will cook unevenly.

video.name: Air Fryer Party Snack Mix "Chex Mix" "Nuts 'N Bolts" - in 15 minutes!

recipeIngredient: 2 cups toasted rice, wheat or corn cereal ((choose any one or combo))
1/2 cup nuts (, your choice - peanuts, cashews, walnuts, etc.)
1/2 teaspoon salt ( *if not using a salted flavoring option, or to taste)
2 teaspoons Ranch seasoning mix ((for salt lovers, use 1 Tablespoon (15ml)))

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, Worcestershire sauce, salt and/ or any flavoring options (our favorite is the Ranch seasoning with no additional salt - the Ranch seasoning is pretty salty on its own).
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, whisk together the melted butter, Worcestershire sauce, salt and/ or any flavoring options (our favorite is the Ranch seasoning with no additional salt - the Ranch seasoning is pretty salty on its own).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cereal, nuts and pretzels to the seasoned butter. Stir to completely coat the cereal with the butter mix. Taste for flavor and adjust to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cereal, nuts and pretzels to the seasoned butter. Stir to completely coat the cereal with the butter mix. Taste for flavor and adjust to your preference.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the coated cereal mix out evenly in the air fryer basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the coated cereal mix out evenly in the air fryer basket/tray.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 250°F for 12-16 minutes, tossing and shaking every 5 minutes.  Allow to cool completely and then serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 250°F for 12-16 minutes, tossing and shaking every 5 minutes.  Allow to cool completely and then serve.

name: Quick Homemade Air Fryer Crispy French Fries
description: The texture of these air fried homemade fries are like a crispy roasted texture. They don't have all the deep fried oil for that big "crunch". But there's hardly any oil so they're still delicous and worth the effort.
recipeIngredient: 1 pound fresh potatoes (, cut into 1/4” french fry size)

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and cut potatoes into french fry sizes. NOTE: Try to keep them as evenly sized as possible for even cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Add potatoes to bowl. Drizzle olive oil evenly over the potatoes. Sprinkle salt and pepper (and/or garlic powder) evenly over potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil and season potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Gently toss the potatoes to evenly coat with oil and seasonings. Place the potatoes in air fryer basket and spread them evenly over the basket or rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air fry potatoes at 380°F/193°C for about 18-22 minutes. About halfway through cooking, shake the basket and gently turn the potatoes. Try not to break them. For crisper potatoes, shake them a second time and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with ketchup or your favorite dip. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer French Fries, French Fries, Homemade

name: Air Fryer Coconut Shrimp with Orange-Soy Dipping Sauce
description: One of the great recipes from our Air Fryer Holidays: Thanksgiving and Christmas ebook. Be ready to make a double batch of these because they’re sure to be a hit! You can always make them a day ahead of time and re-heat before serving. These coconut shrimp taste just as good re-heated the next day.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. large shrimp (, peeled and deveined)
1 Tablespoon chili garlic sauce (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Rinse and pat dry the shrimp. Season all sides of shrimp with paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season shrimp

recipeInstructions.text: You’ll need 3 bowls: In first bowl, add the flour. In second bowl, whisk together eggs. In third bowl combine coconut flakes and bread crumbs. Coat shrimp in flour mixture, then dip in egg mixture, then coat the shrimp with the coconut/bread crumb mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Arrange coatings

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the air fryer basket/tray with oil spray. Lay the coated shrimp in a single layer (cook in batches if needed). Lightly spray coated shrimp with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F for about 10-14 minutes or until the crust is golden brown, flipping after 8 minutes if needed for even cooking. Cooking times will vary depending on shrimp size.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: For the Dipping Sauce: Whisk together the all of the dipping sauce ingredients (marmalade, chili garlic sauce, rice vinegar, and soy sauce) until smooth. Set aside until ready to serve with the coconut shrimp.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Sauce

keywords: Air Fryer, Coconut Shrimp, Orange Soy Sauce

name: Air Fryer Frozen Waffles
description: Different brands frozen waffles all vary in size,  thickness, ingredients (some with more sweetener might brown quicker, different flours, etc. ) so you’ll have to adjust timing. Only cook a single layer's worth at time for even cooking. Cook in multiple batches if needed.All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These  were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary depending on individual brands.

recipeInstructions.name: Place the frozen waffles in the air fryer basket and spread in an even layer (make sure they aren't overlapping). No oil spray is needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 4 minutes. Flip the waffles over and continue to Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for another 1-3 minutes or until to your preferred doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 4 minutes. Flip the waffles over and continue to Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for another 1-3 minutes or until to your preferred doneness.

name: Air Fryer Parmesan Corn with Garlic
description:
Our recipe uses garlic powder but  you can use fresh garlic if you like. Just make sure to mince it super fine. 

Air fry as many ears that will fit in a single layer in your air fryer basket/tray. Trim to size if necessary. If you cook with more or less corn, it will affect cooking times. Reduce timing a little for 1-2 ears of corn, and increase time for more corn.

recipeIngredient: 3 ear fresh corn (, shucked and cleaned)
1 teaspoon garlic powder (, or to taste)
1/4 cup grated Parmesan (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Shuck and clean the corn. For smaller air fryers, cut the corn in half. For other air fryers, just trim the ends of corn to fit into your air fryer basket/tray if necessary.
recipeInstructions.name: Clean corn

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the corn with softened butter. Season with garlic powder, salt, and black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season corn

recipeInstructions.text: Place in the air fryer basket/tray in a single layer. If needed, air fry in batches to keep the corn in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 10 minutes. Flip the corn.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Continue Air Frying for 3-8 minutes more or until corn is tender and cooked to your preference. (Cooking time will depend on size of corn, how full air fryer basket is, & different models/sizes of air fryers).
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and continue air frying

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the corn from the air fryer basket/tray. Generously coat with parmesan and parsley. Serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat with parmesan

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Corn on the Cob, Garlic Parmesan Corn

name: Air Fryer Chicken Egg Rolls
description: Please read the website write up on this recipe. There’s lots of valuable info and photo tutorials there.  Please try to read it in order to have the best cooking results. The magic ingredient to these egg rolls is the fish sauce, don't be scared! You'll pleased with the rich umami flavor. For the Hoisin-Peanut dip: Some hoisin sauces are thicker than others. Adjust the water amount in the recipe to your desired dip consistency.Feel free to substitute whatever ground meat you prefer (pork, turkey, beef, etc...)

video.name: Air Fryer Homemade Chicken Egg Rolls with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-egg-rolls/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk INGREDIENTS CHICKEN VEGETABLE EGG ROLLS 1 pound ground chicken *see head note 2 Tablespoons vegetable oil 3 cloves garlic , minced or crushed 1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger root , optional 1 Tablespoon soy sauce (or fish sauce for more flavor) 1/2 teaspoon sesame seed oil 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt , or to taste freshly grated black pepper 2 cups cabbage , shredded thin 1/2 cup grated carrot , (about 1 medium carrot) 3 green onions , small chopped 1 large egg 1 package egg roll wrappers or sometimes called "spring roll pastry" wrappers in the freezer section of market. oil or oil spray , for coating rolls HOISIN-PEANUT DIP 1/2 cup hoisin 1/4 cup peanut butter chili hot sauce or Sriracha Sauce (optional) 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil , or to taste 2 teaspoons vinegar , or to taste about 1/2 cup water , or to preferred dip consistency ? Print Full Recipe Here ? ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 pound ground chicken ( (or pork, beef) *see head note)
1 teaspoon freshly grated ginger root (, optional)
1 Tablespoon soy sauce ((or fish sauce for more flavor))
1/2  teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
14 (about) egg roll wrappers (or sometimes called "spring roll pastry" wrappers in the freezer section of market.)
oil or oil spray (, for coating rolls)
chili hot sauce ( or Sriracha Sauce (optional))
1/2 teaspoon sesame oil (, or to taste)
about 1/2 cup water (, or to preferred dip consistency)

itemListElement.text: Cook the filling: Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil and then add the garlic and optional ginger. Cook for about 1 minute or until lightly browned. Add the ground chicken, soy sauce, sesame seed oil, salt and pepper. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the chicken is lightly browned.
itemListElement.name: Cook filling

itemListElement.text: Add the veggies: cabbage, carrots, and green onions. Cook for another 1-2 minutes or until the vegetables soften. Stir in the egg and cook for another 30 seconds. Remove from heat, place the cooked filling in a colander to drain excess juices and allow to cool.
itemListElement.name: Add veggies

itemListElement.text: Make the dip while the chicken filling is cooling. In bowl, combine all ingredients (hoisin, peanut butter, hot sauce, sesame oil, water, and vinegar) and whisk together. If you are making a very large batch, you can use a blender by blending all the ingredients together. But make sure you add enough water because some brands of hoisin are very thick.
itemListElement.name: Make dip

recipeInstructions.name: How to Roll and Air Fry

itemListElement.text: Using egg roll wrappers or spring roll wrappers, add about 1-2 Tablespoons of chicken filling to each wrapper (depending on the size of the wrapper) Tuck and roll the wrapper around the filling (watch the video and look at the photos in the post above to see how to roll even and tight rolls).
itemListElement.name: Roll egg rolls

itemListElement.text: Brush the top corner of the wrapper with water or beaten egg to help seal the wrapper end, and then finish rolling the egg roll. Repeat for all the egg rolls. Brush or spray rolls with oil to coat
itemListElement.name: Seal egg rolls

itemListElement.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 8 minutes. Flip the egg rolls. If they look dry, spray the egg rolls with oil again.
itemListElement.name: Air Fry and flip

itemListElement.text: Continue air frying for 6 minutes or until the wrapper is crispy and browned. If needed add another 1-2 minutes. If you use the larger wrapper cook a little longer so that all the layers can cook through to avoid being tough and chewy.
itemListElement.name: Air Fry

itemListElement.text: Serve warm with hoisin-peanut dip. You can also wrap these chicken vegetable egg rolls in lettuce and eat them as lettuce egg roll wraps!
itemListElement.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Avocado Egg Rolls, Chicken, Fried Recipes

name: Air Fryer Sweet Potato French Fries
description: For even cooking, make sure to cut the sweet potatoes to about the same size and thickness so they will all cook evenly. Eat them while they're still warm for best "crispy" texture. We like to keep the skin-on because the skin crisps up nicely, adding to a better texture.

recipeIngredient: 1 pound sweet potatoes (, cut into 1/4” french fry size)

recipeInstructions.text: We like to keep the skin-on for crispier fries. But you can peel the sweet potatoes if you want. Wash and dry the sweet potatoes completely. Cut the sweet potatoes into french fry size and thickness.  Keep them same sized as possible for even cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: We like to keep the skin-on for crispier fries. But you can peel the sweet potatoes if you want. Wash and dry the sweet potatoes completely. Cut the sweet potatoes into french fry size and thickness.  Keep them same sized as possible for even cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the sweet potatoes in a bowl and then lightly coat them with olive oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper (and/or garlic powder) evenly over the sweet potatoes. Genlty toss to evenly coat all the fries with oil and seasonings.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the sweet potatoes in a bowl and then lightly coat them with olive oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper (and/or garlic powder) evenly over the sweet potatoes. Genlty toss to evenly coat all the fries with oil and seasonings.

recipeInstructions.text: Lay the sweet potatoes in the air fryer basket and spread them into an even layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay the sweet potatoes in the air fryer basket and spread them into an even layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F for about 18-22 minutes. A couple times during cooking, gently shake the basket, turn or toss the sweet potatoes to help them cook evenly. Try not to break them. For crisper potatoes, shake them again and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes or until they are your desired texture and doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 380°F for about 18-22 minutes. A couple times during cooking, gently shake the basket, turn or toss the sweet potatoes to help them cook evenly. Try not to break them. For crisper potatoes, shake them again and cook for an additional 2-4 minutes or until they are your desired texture and doneness.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the zucchinis in half lengthwise and then into wedges, 1-inch (2.5cm) at the base (usually quartered for small-medium sized zucchini). Lightly spray zucchini with oil. Season all sides with garlic powder, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap with bacon and then season with extra black pepper (optional). Toothpick the bacon into the zucchini to stay in place, and then put in the air fryer basket/tray.

name: Air Fryer Breaded Asparagus Fries
description: Cooking times will vary depending on the size of your asparagus and the your air fryer. Start on the lowest suggested time, then add more time if needed to your personal liking.
