recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder (, or to taste)
1/4 cup bread crumbs ((Italian style or Japanese panko))
Oil spray (, for coating asparagus fries)
Dips: hot sauce, ranch, bbq sauce, etc ((optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat air fryer at 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Trim the tough bottom ends of the asparagus (usually about the bottom 1-2 inches).
recipeInstructions.name: Trim the tough bottom ends of the asparagus (usually about the bottom 1-2 inches).

recipeInstructions.text: Lay the asparagus out on a board or plate and brush with the beaten egg. Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic powder evenly over asparagus. Gently toss to coat evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat with egg and season

recipeInstructions.text: On a plate combine the bread crumbs and parmesan cheese.  Toss seasoned asparagus in the bread crumb/parmesan mix, gently shaking off any excess coating.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat with bread crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Spray all sides of the breaded asparagus with oil spray. Dry breading might fly around in air fryer and burn, so make sure to coat any dry spots.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket/tray and place asparagus in the air fryer in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 5-8 minutes. Gently flip and spray any remaining dry spots with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for additional 3-5 minutes or until crispy golden brown. Serve warm with your favorite dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and air fry

recipeIngredient: 1 cup enchilada sauce ((or enough to coat))
Sour Cream, Guacamole, Salsa, Pico de gallo, shredded Lettuce or Cabbage, Hot Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen taquitos in a single layer in an oven safe dish that fits your air fryer.  Coat the taquitos evenly with light oil spray or oil brush.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray taquitos with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for about 7-10 minutes, flipping halfway through cooking. Air fry until the taquitos are heated through the center and crispy on the outside.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Stir or shake the enchilada sauce so it’s mixed well. Pour the enchiladas sauce over the taquitos, just enough to cover the top of the taquitos. Don’t add too much sauce because the circulating fan might blow the sauce around.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce

recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Spread cheese on top and Air Fry for another minute or until cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with any desired toppings: sour cream, guacamole, salsa, pico, hot sauce, or on a bed of shredded lettuce or cabbage.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Hot Dogs
description: If you don't like to have crispy hot dog edges, then make sure to wrap the bacon all the way to the tips. Cook the hot dogs and bacon to what ever doneness you like. Just check them halfway though the cooking time and adjust the remainder of your time to your personal taste and texture. One way to keep the bacon from shrinking away from the hot dog ends is to use toothpicks to secure the bacon. Make sure to remove the toothpick before eating!

Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-bacon-wrapped-hot-dogs/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: For serving: ketchup, mustard, BBQ sauce, pickles, jalapeños, onions, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap the bacon slices around hot dogs snugly. If you want, you can use a toothpick to secure the bacon to the hot dog.  Make sure bacon covers the tips of the hot dogs. Place in air fryer basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap hot dogs with bacon

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 8-10 minutes depending on your preferred texture, size of hot dogs, and how cooked you like your bacon.  Flip the hot dogs half way through cooking.  If using toothpicks - REMOVE the tooth pics before serving! If you like your hot dogs & bacon extra crispy, cook them a little hotter. Use these instructions instead: Air Fry at 400°F/204°C for about 6-8 minutes. Flip the hot dogs half way through cooking. If using toothpicks - REMOVE the tooth pics before serving!
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: For crispy warm hot dog buns: Place bacon wrapped hot dogs in the buns and air fry for another minute or until the bread is warm. Serve with your favorite toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm buns

keywords: Air Fryer, Bacon, Bacon Wrapped, Hot Dogs

name: Air Fryer White Castle Breakfast Slider Hack
description: Do not thaw the sliders before air frying. Don’t air fry the sliders whole. By the time the meat patty is heated, the top bun would be super crispy. You’ll want to remove the top bun and air fry the bottom bun and meat patty first. Then add the top bun to the air fryer and heat it up too. For the scramble, you can make it in a pan or in the microwave. Here is a great recipe for an easy Microwaved Scrambled Egg.

video.name: Air Fryer White Castle Breakfast Slider Hack
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-white-castle-breakfast-sliders/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py INGREDIENTS 6 Frozen White Castle Sliders 1 Tablespoon Butter 3 large Eggs , beaten OPTIONAL CONDIMENTS Ketchup, Hot Sauce, BBQ Sauce, Salsa, Avocado , etc. ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-white-castle-breakfast-sliders/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: Ketchup, Hot Sauce, BBQ Sauce, Salsa, Avocado (, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: In a pan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook the scrambled eggs until set. Set aside. For microwave instructions, see this recipe for Microwaved Scrambled Eggs.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pan over medium heat, melt the butter and cook the scrambled eggs until set. Set aside. For microwave instructions, see this recipe for Microwaved Scrambled Eggs.

recipeInstructions.text: Do not preheat the air fryer. Using a fork, carefully remove the top bun to expose the meat. Set top bun aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Separate top bun

recipeInstructions.text: Place the just the bottom bun and patty in the air fryer, meat side up.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the just the bottom bun with meat and cheese at 340°F/171°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry bottom

recipeInstructions.text: Add the top bun to the air fryer next to bottom buns (not on top of).  Air Fry for 1 minute until top bun is warmed. If you want the slider hotter and crisper, air fry for another 1-2 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry top bun

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the scrambled eggs on top of the meat and cheese slider bottom halves.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the scrambled eggs on top of the meat and cheese slider bottom halves.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ketchup, hot sauce, or whatever else you love on your breakfast slider, top with the bun and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Add ketchup, hot sauce, or whatever else you love on your breakfast slider, top with the bun and enjoy!

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Frozen, Sliders, White Castle Sliders

name: Air Fryer Bacon Wrapped Corn on The Cob
description: You can wrap 1-2 slices of bacon. Two slices for the bacon lovers! If you’re wrapping with 2 slices of bacon, you don’t need to spray the corn because it’ll be mostly covered with bacon oil during cooking. 1 slice of bacon will leave un-covered corn, so that’s when the spray is helpful to make sure the whole corn doesn’t get dry.
recipeIngredient: 2-4 ears fresh corn (, shucked and cleaned)
2-8 slices bacon (, depending on how much corn & if you do double bacon or not)

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, cut ends of corn to fit into your air fryer basket/tray. Or for smaller air fryers, cut the corn in half.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Corn

recipeInstructions.text: Coat all sides of the corn with light oil spray (if you’re using only 1 bacon strip/ear). If needed, make sure to spray the ends of the corn is where it can often get dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Corn

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap bacon around the corn. Skewer one toothpick to secure each end of bacon to corn. Skewer the toothpick side-ways into the corn and bacon so it does’t stick up too much. (see our photos for the technique). Season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap Bacon

recipeInstructions.text: For 2 corn - Air Fry at 380°F for 10 minutes. Flip the corn. Continue Air Frying for another 3-8 minutes or until bacon is crisp and corn is tender.For 4 corn - Air Fry at 380°F for 10 minutes. Flip the corn. Continue Air Frying for another 6-10 minutes or until bacon is crisp and corn is tender. (Cooking time will depend on size of corn, thickness of the bacon, how full air fryer basket is, & different models/sizes of air fryers).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, flip once more and Air Fry for a couple more minutes or until the bacon is crispy on all sides.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and finish cooking

recipeInstructions.text: Remove toothpicks before eating. Add butter if desired and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Remove toothpicks and serve.

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fryer, Bacon, Corn on the Cob, Fair Foods

name: Air Fryer Easy Donuts
description: Making air fryer donuts is a great way to enjoy a warm, fresh, homemade air fried doughnut in minutes. It’s quick, easy and simple by using your favorite refrigerated crescent dough or biscuit dough.

video.name: Air Fryer Easy Donuts with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-donuts-recipe/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 1 can refrigerated flaky biscuits , like Pillsbury Grands! Flaky Biscuits ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-donuts-recipe/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1  can refrigerated flaky biscuits (, like Pillsbury Grands! Flaky Biscuits)

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the biscuits and with a 1-inch biscuit cutter, cut holes out of the center of the biscuits. Make sure to save the hole cut outs to air fry as donut holes.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Donuts

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat the air fryer basket/tray with oil spray. Place the donuts in a single layer in the basket/tray making sure they aren’t touching (you may need to cook in batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Add to Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for 6-7 minutes, then gently wiggle to loosen. Flip over and continue Air Frying at 330°F/165°C for 1-3 minutes or until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining donuts and donut holes (they may cook a little quicker since the air fryer is now heated up).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: While still warm, top with your preferred topping, glaze, or frosting (see note below for cinnamon-sugar topping).
recipeInstructions.name: Top

keywords: Air Fryer, Canned Biscuits, Donuts, Doughnuts

name: Air Fryer Crispy Breaded Cauliflower Bites
description: Cooking times will vary depending on how big you cut the cauliflower florets and on your specific air fryer. Start on the lowest suggested time, then add more time if needed to your personal liking. One egg should be enough if you stir and soak the cauliflower in the egg at the bottom of the bowl. But if you feel like you need more, then use 2 large eggs.

video.name: Air Fryer Crispy Breaded Cauliflower Bites
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-breaded-cauliflower-bites/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 1/2 pound (227 g) fresh cauliflower , cut into bite sized florets (about 2 cups) 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) salt , or to taste black pepper , preferably fresh ground 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) garlic powder Optional Seasonings: Lemon pepper seasoning, paprika, cajun spices, Montreal steak seasoning, etc 1 egg , beaten 1/2 cup (54 g) bread crumbs (regular or Japanese panko) 2 Tablespoons (30 ml) grated parmesan cheese Optional Dips: hot sauce, ranch, bbq sauce, etc. ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-breaded-cauliflower-bites/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound fresh cauliflower (, cut into bite sized florets (about 2 cups))
Optional Seasonings: (Lemon pepper seasoning, paprika, cajun spices, Montreal steak seasoning, etc)
1/2 cup bread crumbs ((regular or Japanese panko))
Optional Dips: hot sauce, ranch, bbq sauce, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat air fryer at 360°F/182°C for about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine the cauliflower florets, salt, pepper, and garlic powder (and any other optional seasoning you prefer). Gently toss to evenly coat the cauliflower. Add beaten egg and stir to coat the cauliflower.
recipeInstructions.name: Season cauliflower and add egg

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl combine the bread crumbs and parmesan cheese  Dip cauliflower florets in the bread crumb mix and gently shake off excess coating.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat cauliflower in bread crumbs

recipeInstructions.text: Spray all sides of the breaded cauliflower with oil spray. Dry breading might fly around in air fryer and burn, so make sure to coat any dry spots.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket/tray with oil (or line with a perforated silicone mat or parchment paper) and place cauliflower in a single layer in the basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 5-8 minutes. Gently flip and spray any dry spots with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for additional 3-5 minutes or until they are crispy golden brown OR to your preferred texture.  Serve warm with your favorite dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish air frying

keywords: Air Fryer, Breaded, Cauliflower

name: Air Fryer Shrimp Cocktail
description: There's lots of possibilties to customize the flavors. Make it more spicy, by adding more horseradish or hot sauce.  You can make-ahead the shrimp cocktail sauce and it keeps for quite a while.

video.name: Air Fryer Shrimp Cocktail (Awesome & Easy Appetizer!) with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-shrimp-cocktail/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk INGREDIENTS FOR THE SHRIMP 1 pound raw shrimp , deveined and shells removed 1 teaspoon oil , to coat shrimp salt , to taste black pepper , to taste SHRIMP COCKTAIL SAUCE 1/2 cup ketchup 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon prepared horseradish 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice 1/4 teaspoon celery salt 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder 1/4 teaspoon salt , or to taste black pepper to taste fresh lemon slices 1 small cucumber , sliced (optional) fresh herbs for garnish (optional) ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-shrimp-cocktail/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 pound raw shrimp (, deveined and shells removed)
1/2 cup ketchup ((or low-carb tomato sauce for keto) )

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, fresh lemon juice, celery salt, garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Stir until well mixed then set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In bowl, combine ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, fresh lemon juice, celery salt, garlic powder, salt and black pepper. Stir until well mixed then set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: After shrimp shells are removed and de-veined, rinse and pat dry the shrimp. Coat shrimp with oil, and then season with salt and pepper. Place the shrimp in the air fryer basket or tray in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: After shrimp shells are removed and de-veined, rinse and pat dry the shrimp. Coat shrimp with oil, and then season with salt and pepper. Place the shrimp in the air fryer basket or tray in a single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry shrimp at 400°F for 8-12 minutes, or until cooked through. Shrimp comes in different sizes so check halfway through to make sure it's cooked enough or to your liking. After air frying, let the shrimp cool completely and chill in the fridge until ready to serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry shrimp at 400°F for 8-12 minutes, or until cooked through. Shrimp comes in different sizes so check halfway through to make sure it's cooked enough or to your liking. After air frying, let the shrimp cool completely and chill in the fridge until ready to serve.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the cooked shrimp with the shrimp cocktail sauce and slices of fresh lemon and cucumbers. Garnish with fresh herbs if you are feeling fancy.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve the cooked shrimp with the shrimp cocktail sauce and slices of fresh lemon and cucumbers. Garnish with fresh herbs if you are feeling fancy.

keywords: Air Fryer, Shrimp, Shrimp Cocktail

name: Air Fryer Halloween Spooky Donuts
description: Halloween donuts are so fun and easy to make in the air fryer. Cut out fun faces and dust with powdered sugar for ghosts or you can frost them with fun halloween colors and sprinkles.

video.name: Air Fryer Spooky Halloween Donuts
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-halloween-donuts/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 16.3 oz (462 g) can refrigerated flaky biscuits , like Pillsbury Grands! Flaky Biscuits TOPPING OPTIONS 1/2 cup (60 g) powdered sugar Halloween colored frostings (black, orange, red, purple, etc…) Halloween inspired sprinkles ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-halloween-donuts/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 16.3 oz can refrigerated flaky biscuits (, like Pillsbury Grands! Flaky Biscuits)
Halloween colored frostings ((black, orange, red, purple, etc…))

recipeInstructions.text: For regular donuts shape: Separate the biscuits and with a 1-inch biscuit cutter, cut holes out of the center of the biscuits. (Save the hole cut outs to air fry as eyeballs if you are up for decorating them).
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Donuts

recipeInstructions.text: If making ghosts: Separate the biscuits and with a 3/4-inch biscuit cutter, cut holes for the eyes and mouth from each biscuit. Stretch the dough lengthwise to create the spooky ghost face. (Save the hole cut outs to air fry as eyeballs if you are up for decorating them).
recipeInstructions.name: Make Ghost Faces

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat the air fryer basket/tray with oil spray. Place the donuts in a single layer in the basket/tray making sure they aren’t touching (you may need to cook in batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for 6-7 minutes, then gently wiggle to loosen. Flip over and continue Air Frying at 330°F/165°C for 1-3 minutes or until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining donut and donut holes (they may cook a little quicker - set the timing a few minutes less and check for doneness sooner).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: While still warm, dust the powdered sugar or frost and sprinkle the donuts in fun Halloween colors.
recipeInstructions.name: Decorate donuts

keywords: Air Fryer, Donuts, Doughnuts, Halloween

name: Air Fryer Mini Pumpkin Pies
description: Using prepared mini graham cracker crusts are perfect to satisfy your cravings for pumpkin pie. This recipe is also perfect for small air fryers. Depending on your basket size, you’ll have to cook the pies in several batches. All air fryers cook differently so after your first batch, you'll know more of what timing is best for your specific air fryer. You can save the filling and cook 1-2 mini pies at a time. The raw filling saves for up to a week. Just wait to fill the crust until you are ready to ready to air fry the mini pies. You can also make the pies one day before serving. Adjust the spices to your individual preference, or just use about 1 teaspoon of pumpkin pie spice.

video.name: Air Fryer Mini Pumpkin Pies
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-mini-pumpkin-pies/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py INGREDIENTS 1 cup (245 g) canned pumpkin puree 2/3 cup (160 ml) sweetened condensed milk 1 large egg 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) ground cinnamon 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) ground nutmeg 1/8 teaspoon (0.62 ml) ground clove 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) ground ginger , optional Pinch of salt 6 mini graham cracker pie crusts (OPTIONAL FOR TOPPING) Whipped Topping or Whipped Cream ground cinnamon ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-mini-pumpkin-pies/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeInstructions.text: In large bowl, whisk pumpkin puree, sweetened condensed milk, egg, spices (cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and optional ginger) and salt until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Filling

recipeInstructions.text: Divide filling into mini crusts. Fill the crusts with the filling until it reaches the top of the crust line (you may have a little filling leftover, depending on your brand of crusts). Place the crusts in the air fryer basket/tray, cook in batches if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour into crusts

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 300°F for 10-12 minutes. Jiggle the pies in the air fryer basket. If the center is liquidy, air fry for a couple more minutes or until semi-firm. After air fryer is turned off, let the pies rest inside the air fryer for 10 minutes to finish cooking in the residual heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pies from air fryer and allow to cool. Top with whipped topping or whipped cream if desired. Sprinkle with optional ground cinnamon.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool

keywords: Air Fryer, Mini Pies, Pie, Pumpkin, Thanksgiving

name: Air Fryer Easy Cake Mix Kit
description: Do not use an air fryer model smaller than 3 qt. The cake pan might fit, but a small air fryer usually burns the top of the cake. The heating element will be too close to the cake. Ingredients needed may differ if using a different cake mix.

recipeIngredient: 8.4 oz Duncan Hines Easy Cake Kit

recipeInstructions.text: Start in cold air fryer. Do not pre-heat. If you cooked something in your air fryer previously and it's still warm, allow it to cool completely. Starting in a pre-heated or warm air fryer will cook the cake too quick on top and the center can still be raw.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Combine cake mix according to package instruction. Pour the batter in to the paper pan that was included in the box kit.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine cake mix

recipeInstructions.text: Place cake in air fryer basket or rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air fry at 320°F/160°C for 20 minutes. After the initial base cooking time, stick a toothpick in the cake. If it's "almost" cooked, turn off air fryer and leave the cake to rest inside the air fryer for 5-10 minutes to gently finish cooking in the residual heat. If the batter is still wet, Air Fry for 2-5 minutes more or until nearly cooked. Then turn off air fryer and leave the cake to rest inside the air fryer for 5-10 minutes to gently finish cooking in the residual heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool. Squeeze the frosting provided over the cake and spread evenly. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Cool, frost and serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Cake, Easy Cake Kit

name: Air Fryer Frozen Breaded Chicken Breasts
description: There's several things which affect how the frozen breaded chicken breasts cook. They all vary in size,  thickness, type and heaviness of the breading so you’ll have to adjust timing. For best and even cooking, don't overcrowd the basket. Fill just an even single layer of chicken breasts. If using uncooked breaded chicken, add an extra minute or two if needed to make sure it is cooked through. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary from brand to brand and will depend on the type of coating.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen breaded chicken breasts in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Make sure they aren't overlapping. No oil spray is needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 10 minutes. Flip the chicken over.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry and flip

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for another 2 minutes. Check the chicken breasts and if needed, add another 2-3 minutes or until heated through and crispy to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Start in cold air fryer. Do not pre-heat. If you cooked something in your air fryer previously and it's still warm, allow it to cool completely. Starting in a pre-heated or warm air fryer will cook the cookie too quick on top and the center can still be raw.

name: Air Fryer Orange Chicken from Frozen
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how frozen orange chicken cooks. Brands all vary in size,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. For best and even cooking, don't overcrowd the basket. Fill just an even single layer of orange chicken. Don't coat the chicken with the sauce until after you air fry the chicken. Heat the sauce separately then toss before serving.All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary from brand to brand and will depend on the type of coating & the sauce.
recipeIngredient: 10 ounces Frozen Orange Chicken ((about 2 cups worth))
Sauce from the Packaged Frozen Orange Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen orange chicken in the air fryer basket and spread out into a single even layer. No oil spray is needed. Set the sauce aside (do not sauce the chicken yet).
recipeInstructions.name: Put chicken in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for 8 minutes. Shake and flip the chicken pieces over and then continue to cook at 400°F/205°C for another 2-4 minutes or until heated through and crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the orange sauce in microwave for 1 minute or on stovetop for 2-3 minutes on medium heat. Toss cooked chicken with sauce and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat sauce

keywords: Air Fryer, Frozen, Orange Chicken

name: Air Fryer Pepperoni Pizza Egg Rolls
description: One of our fair food favorites that we adapated for the Air Fryer. These are great with so many different dips to serve with: marinara, ranch and bbq sauce are delish! Choose your favorite or have several for variety. Makes about 15 egg rolls

video.name: Air Fryer Pepperoni Pizza Egg Rolls with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-pizza-egg-rolls/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 4 ounces pepperoni slices , chopped 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese 1/2 cup marinara sauce , plus extra for dipping 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning (or any combination of dried basil, oregano, thyme, rosemary, etc.) 1/2 cup bell peppers , chopped 15 egg roll wrappers water , for sealing the wrappers oil spray , for coating the egg rolls 1/2-1 cup optional dipping sauce of choice , marinara, ranch, bbq sauce, etc. ? Print Full Recipe Here ? //airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-pizza-egg-rolls/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup marinara sauce (, plus extra for dipping)
1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning ((or any combination of dried basil, oregano, thyme, rosemary, etc.))
oil spray (, for coating the egg rolls)
1/2-1 cup optional dipping sauce of choice (, marinara, ranch, bbq sauce, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Add pepperoni, mozzarella cheese, sauce, Italian seasonings and bell peppers in bowl. Mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Filling

recipeInstructions.text: Using egg roll wrappers or spring roll wrappers, add about 2 Tablespoons of the filling to each wrapper. Tuck and roll the wrapper around the filling (watch the video in the post above to see how to roll even and tight rolls). Brush the top corner of the wrapper with water to help seal the wrapper end, and then finish rolling the egg roll. Repeat for all the egg rolls.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll:

recipeInstructions.text: Brush or spray rolls with oil to coat. Place a single layer of egg rolls in the air fryer basket (cook in batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray:

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry 380°F for 12-16 minutes, flipping halfway through. Cook until the wrapper is crispy and browned. If you use the larger wrapper or if your wrappers are thicker cook a little longer so that all the layers can cook through to avoid being tough and chewy.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry:

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool a little (the filling will be super hot right after cooking), and then serve with your favorite dipping sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve:

keywords: Air Fryer, Egg Rolls, Fair Foods, Pepperoni, Pizza

name: Air Fryer Garlic Parmesan Chicken Bites
description: You can use boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs. Our favorite are thighs because the flavor is more rich and chicken thigh bites are less dry. If you're cooking with chicken breast, make sure to eat them as soon as they're cooled. If you let chicken breast sit too long or get cold, they will taste dry and tough.

video.name: Air Fryer Garlic Parmesan Chicken Bites
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chicken-bites/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get our Favorite Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 1.5 pounds (.39 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs , cut into about 1” bite sized pieces (approximately) 2 teaspoons (10 ml) vegetable oil , or enough to coat chicken 1 Tablespoon (15 ml) Worcestershire sauce 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) dried oregano 1 teaspoon (5 ml) garlic powder or 3 cloves minced garlic 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) onion powder 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) kosher salt , or to taste Fresh cracked black pepper , to taste 2 Tablespoons (30 ml) all-purpose flour or cornstarch oil spray , enough to coat chicken 2-3 Tablespoons (30 ml) grated parmesan cheese 2 Tablespoons (30 ml) chopped parsley ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chicken-bites/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs (, cut into about 1” bite sized pieces (approximately))
2 teaspoons vegetable oil (, or enough to coat chicken)
1 teaspoon garlic powder ( or 3 cloves minced garlic)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
Fresh cracked black pepper (, to taste)
oil spray (, enough to coat chicken)

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl stir together the chicken, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, dried oregano, garlic powder or minced garlic, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle flour or cornstarch evenly over all pieces of chicken and stir to coat. If needed, sprinkle a little more until all pieces of chicken are coated. Generously spray with oil until there are no dry spots of flour or cornstarch.
recipeInstructions.name: In bowl stir together the chicken, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, dried oregano, garlic powder or minced garlic, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Sprinkle flour or cornstarch evenly over all pieces of chicken and stir to coat. If needed, sprinkle a little more until all pieces of chicken are coated. Generously spray with oil until there are no dry spots of flour or cornstarch.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket/tray with oil. Add the chicken and spread into an even, single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray the air fryer basket/tray with oil. Add the chicken and spread into an even, single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F for 10 minutes. Stir and flip the chicken and then Air Fry from another 5 minutes. Stir and flip one more time, then Air Fry for an additional 3-5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 360°F for 10 minutes. Stir and flip the chicken and then Air Fry from another 5 minutes. Stir and flip one more time, then Air Fry for an additional 3-5 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the parmesan cheese and parsley, then Air Fry at 360°F for 1 minute to slightly melt the cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste if desired and serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the parmesan cheese and parsley, then Air Fry at 360°F for 1 minute to slightly melt the cheese. Add salt and pepper to taste if desired and serve warm.

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken Bites, Garlic Parmesan

name: Air Fryer Bacon
description: BEST TIP: Test 1 piece of bacon first so you can see what your preferred timing and crispness is based on your air fryer mode. Everyone has a personal preference for bacon crispness. If you find that your Air Fryer can cook it better when it's hotter, then go for it. Timing varies with different size air fryer styles and models. Air frying bacon in best in basket style air fryers. Oven style air fryers will be messier. Thickness of bacon will change cooking time too. Air fry a little longer for thick cut bacon.

video.name: Air Fryer Crispy Bacon
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-bacon/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py INGREDIENTS 2-4 slices bacon depending on your air fryer basket size optional – slice of bread , to absorb bacon drippings minimizing smoking optional salt & pepper ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-bacon/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 2-4 slices bacon (depending on your air fryer basket size)
optional - slice of bread (, to absorb bacon drippings minimizing smoking)

recipeInstructions.text: Optional - To minimize smoking, add a slice of bread under the air fryer perforated tray. Place the perforated tray back into the basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Place slice of bread under tray

recipeInstructions.text: Do not preheat the Air fryer (if air fryer is already preheated, reduce cooking time). Lay the bacon slices in single layer in your air fryer basket. Try not to let the bacon overlay each other too much. It will prevent them from crisping evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Put bacon in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air fry at 380°F/193°C for 8 minutes. Flip the bacon.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry and flip

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry for 1-3 minutes, or until crisped to your liking.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Discard the bread under the air fryer perforated tray. If you like the timing and temp for the way the bacon turned out, write it down and save it! If not, make adjustments on your next batch. If needed add a touch of extra salt &/or black pepper for extra deliciousness.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Bacon

name: Air Fryer Sliders
description: Higher fat beef will shrink much more than leaner beef. If using 85% or fattier beef, make sure to make the patties extra wide and a bit bigger to accommodate the shrinkage. Have fun with the toppings. Since sliders are so little, they lend well to extra flavorful toppings & sauces.

video.name: Air Fryer Sliders
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-sliders/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 1 lb. (454 g) ground beef (or chicken, turkey, pork, lamb) 1 Tablespoon (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) garlic powder salt , to taste black pepper , to taste 6-8 slider buns or rolls BURGER TOPPINGS: lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion slices, ketchup, mustard, gochujang, hot sauce, bbq sauce, cheese, blue cheese, avocado, bacon, fried onions, etc ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-sliders/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. ground beef ((or chicken, turkey, pork, lamb))
lettuce, tomato, pickles, onion slices, blue cheese, avocado, bacon, fried onions, etc.
ketchup, mustard, mayo, gochujang, hot sauce, bbq sauce, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the air fryer at 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the beef, Worcestershire, and garlic powder until just combined. Divide mixture into 6-8 even balls. Lightly flatten each ball to form a small patty. For best texture, try not to overwork the patties. Form them just enough so that the patties hold their shape.
recipeInstructions.name: Make the patties

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray patties with oil. Season liberal amount of salt and pepper on top of patties.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil and season

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket/tray with oil & place the sliders in the basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air fry 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes. Flip the patties and cook for another 1-3 minutes, or until the center is cooked to your preferred doneness or internal temperature reaches 160°F.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: For Cheeseburger Sliders: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: For best juiciness, cover the patties and let rest for a couple minutes. While patties are resting, warm the buns in the air fryer at 380°F/193°C for about 1 minute. Serve on buns, topped with your favorite toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Rest and warm buns

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fryer, Beef, Cheeseburger, Hamburgers, Sliders

name: Low-Carb Air Fryer Scotch Eggs
description: Scotch eggs are awesome for breakfast and brunch. Theyre a great conversation piece when everyone sees the boiled egg stuffed in sausage. You can use your favorite sausage like Sweet Italian, Breakfast Sausage, Chicken Apple, etc. A little swipe of mustard and hot sauce makes these even more delicious!

video.name: Low Carb Air Fryer Scotch Eggs with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-scotch-eggs/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 1 pound uncooked bulk sausage 5-6 hard boiled eggs , peeled 1-2 raw eggs , beaten 1 cup coating choice (crushed pork rinds, almond flour, coconut flour or preferred coating *see notes below) Mustard and/or hot sauce oil spray , for coating ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-scotch-eggs/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 cup coating choice ((crushed pork rinds, almond flour, coconut flour or preferred coating *see notes below))
Mustard and/or hot sauce oil spray (, for coating)

recipeInstructions.text: Divide the sausage into 5 or 6 equal parts, depending on how thick you want the sausage to wrap around the egg.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide the sausage into 5 or 6 equal parts, depending on how thick you want the sausage to wrap around the egg.

recipeInstructions.text: For each portion of sausage, flatten nto a thin patty about 4” wide. Place the boiled egg in center and wrap sausage around the whole egg. Repeat for all eggs.
recipeInstructions.name: For each portion of sausage, flatten nto a thin patty about 4” wide. Place the boiled egg in center and wrap sausage around the whole egg. Repeat for all eggs.

recipeInstructions.text: Add beaten raw eggs to a bowl. Dip sausage-wrapped egg in raw egg mixture, then in breading. Spray outside of coated egg evenly with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Add beaten raw eggs to a bowl. Dip sausage-wrapped egg in raw egg mixture, then in breading. Spray outside of coated egg evenly with oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F for 12-16 minutes, turn halfway through cooking. The thicker the sausage layer, the longer it takes to cook.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 400°F for 12-16 minutes, turn halfway through cooking. The thicker the sausage layer, the longer it takes to cook.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut in half and serve with mustard swipe on top of yolk. Add hot sauce, too, if you want. Delicous!
recipeInstructions.name: Cut in half and serve with mustard swipe on top of yolk. Add hot sauce, too, if you want. Delicous!

keywords: Air Fryer, Hard Boiled Eggs, Sausage

name: Air Fryer Pumpkin Pie
description: Yes, it’s possible to air fry a regular size pumpkin pie! This 8-9 inch pumpkin pie is for air fryer ovens or toaster oven styles. Because the heating element will be close to the pie, you’ll get a slightly darker top than you would if cooked in the regular oven. But it’s still a great option to make pie if you’re limited on regular oven space. If you don’t want to use pumpkin pie spice you can use 1 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg, 1/4 teaspoon ground clove, and 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger (optional). If you like your pies on the sweeter side, you can add some extra sugar into the pie filling mixture.
recipeIngredient: 15 oz. O Organics® Pumpkin Puree ((1 can))
14 oz. O Organics® Sweetened Condensed Milk ((1 can))
2 teaspoons O Organics® Pumpkin Pie Spice
Optional - 1-2 teaspoons O Organics® Sugar (, or to taste)
Whipped Topping or Whipped Cream, O Organics® Ground Cinnamon

recipeInstructions.text: Grease an 8-9 inch pie pan with about 1 Tablespoon of butter. Lay the sheet of pie dough into the prepared pie pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Prepare pie pan

recipeInstructions.text: Pinch the edges of the crust to form a decorative edge. Poke holes with a fork on bottom and edges of pie dough. Melt the remaining butter and brush the edges of the pie crust with the melted butter.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush crust

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine together the pumpkin puree, sweetened condensed milk, eggs, pumpkin pie spice, optional sugar, and salt. Whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make filling

recipeInstructions.text: Pour pumpkin mixture into crust. Place the pie in the air fryer on the lowest rack.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour filling into crust

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 280°F for about 40 minutes or until the center of the pie is just barely jiggly. After air fryer is turned off, let the pie rest inside the air fryer for 10 minutes to finish cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pie from air fryer and allow to cool. Chill the pie until ready to serve. Top with whipped topping or whipped cream and cinnamon if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Chill

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fryer, Pumpkin Pie

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine the Impossible™ Burger with optional garlic powder, mixing until just combined (if using pre-formed patties, just sprinkle garlic powder on top). Form 3 equal sized patties about 4-inches wide. Spray or brush both sides with oil and season with salt and pepper. (Tip: lightly oil your hands so the patties stick less to your hands when forming)
recipeInstructions.name: Form patties

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket or rack with oil. Carefully lay patties in the air fryer in a single layer. Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the patties and continue cooking for about 3-6 minutes or until cooked through and internal temperature is 160°F/71°C.  Timing will vary depending on thickness of patties and individual air fryer model.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: For Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the buns in the air fryer at 380°F/193°C for about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat buns

recipeInstructions.text: Serve on buns, topped with your favorite burger toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Canned Crescent Rolls
description: Air Fryer cooking times will vary a lot depending on your size and style of air fryer.  Check the crescents after the first 6 minutes to make sure it’s cooking to your preferred texture. After cooking in your specific air fryer, you’ll know what time and temp works best for the crescent rolls you have. We suggest cooking them slightly “crisper” or more golden brown on on the outside to make sure the crescents are cooked all the way through. Read our detailed blog write up with helpful photos regarding issues and best method for air frying these crescent rolls.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket or racks with oil to keep the crescent rolls from sticking. We don’t suggest using parchment paper underneath because you want maximum air flow under the crescents to help them cook all the way though. The parchment paper prevents maximum air flow.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray the air fryer basket or racks with oil to keep the crescent rolls from sticking. We don’t suggest using parchment paper underneath because you want maximum air flow under the crescents to help them cook all the way though. The parchment paper prevents maximum air flow.

recipeInstructions.text: Lay crescent rolls in single layer on air fryer basket/rack. Make sure to space them out so they aren't touching & have room to rise & expand.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay crescent rolls in single layer on air fryer basket/rack. Make sure to space them out so they aren't touching & have room to rise & expand.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for about 6-7 minutes. Gently wiggle to loosen from the baskets.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for about 6-7 minutes. Gently wiggle to loosen from the baskets.

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, continue to Air Fry for another 1-3 minutes, or until they are crispy brown and cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: If needed, continue to Air Fry for another 1-3 minutes, or until they are crispy brown and cooked through.

keywords: Air Fryer, Canned Crescent Rolls

name: Air Fryer Halloween Mummy Dogs
description: The mummy "bandages" work fine from either the regular crescent dough or the crescent dough sheets. It is easier to cut long strips from crescent dough sheets, but they are often harder to find. The bandages still work and look great from the random lengths cut from the regular crescents.  Our favorite way to make the mummies is with the cheese filled hot dogs or sausages, like Johnsonville's Beddar with Cheddar brats. Make the with your favorite hot dogs or sausages.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz. refrigerated crescent dough (or crescent dough sheets , see headnote)

recipeInstructions.text: Unroll the crescent dough. Cut into 3/8"-1/2" (9mm-13mm) wide strips.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut crescent dough

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the hot dogs dry (helps keep the dough from slipping around while rolling). Wrap a couple pieces of dough around each hot dog to look like bandages. Criss-cross them occasionally and make sure to leave a separation of the bandages on one end for the face. Stretch the dough if needed. Word of Caution: Don't wrap too many layers on top of each other or else the underlying ones may not cook all the way. Repeat for the remaining dough and hot dogs.
recipeInstructions.name: Wrap Hot Dogs

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray the ends of the wrapped hot dogs with oil spray. Spray the air fryer basket with oil spray. Lay the wrapped hot dogs face-side up in the air fryer basket or tray, making sure the mummies aren't touching (cook in batches if needed).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray end of hot dogs

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F (166°C) for 6 minutes. Gently wiggle to loosen from the baskets. Air Fry at 330°F (166°C) for another 1-3 minutes or until crescent dough is golden, and cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Dot the face with mustard and ketchup (or hot sauce) for the eyes and any other desired facial features. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Make eyes with mustard & ketchup

keywords: Canned Crescent Rolls, Halloween, Hot Dogs, Mummy Dogs

name: Air Fryer Jiffy Cornbread “Corn Muffin Mix”
description: This popular brand of cornbread is a quick and easy way to enjoy a small batch in the air fryer. It’s a great tasting cornbread that’s both economical and perfect for small servings.This timing is for a 6 qt. air fryer that fits the 7” cake bucket or 8” shallow pizza pan from air fryer accessory kits. The more shallow the pan, the better it will cook all the way through. If your pan is too narrow and deep, then the outside of the cornbread might be too burnt while the middle is still raw.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the corn muffin mix, egg and milk. Mix just enough so that there are no dry spots. Do not over-mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the corn muffin mix, egg and milk. Mix just enough so that there are no dry spots. Do not over-mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat your baking pan with oil spray and fill with the batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly coat your baking pan with oil spray and fill with the batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 320°F at 16-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center. If after 22 minutes the toothpick isn’t fully clean yet but the edges of the cornbread are crisp, then turn off the heat and leave corn bread in the air fryer for about 10 minutes to allow the residual heat to continue cooking the cornbread.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 320°F at 16-22 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center. If after 22 minutes the toothpick isn’t fully clean yet but the edges of the cornbread are crisp, then turn off the heat and leave corn bread in the air fryer for about 10 minutes to allow the residual heat to continue cooking the cornbread.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool in the pan. It will release from the sides as it cools, making it easier to cut.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow to cool in the pan. It will release from the sides as it cools, making it easier to cut.

name: Air Fryer Cornish Hens
description:
Perfect for air frying, these Cornish hens are juicy and flavorful. Most hens average 16-24 ounces are great for smaller air fryers. 
If air frying just one Cornish hen, Air Fry at 350°F/177°C. The timing & directions remain the same.
recipeIngredient: 1 teaspoon dried basil ((or herbs of choice))

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, combine seasonings (garlic powder, smoked paprika, basil, salt, and pepper).
recipeInstructions.name: Combine Seasonings

recipeInstructions.text: Spray Cornish hens with oil to coat. Rub seasoning mix around the hens.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Cornish Hens

recipeInstructions.text: Spray basket/tray of air fryer with oil spray or line with a perforated silicone liner or perforated parchment paper. Lay hens breast side down in the basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 20 minutes then flip the hens.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, crumple some foil and place under the front of the Cornish hens to level them and keep the legs from sticking upwards toward the top of the air fryer where the heating element can get too hot. This will keep the legs from burning.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry for another 12-18 or until internal temperature reaches 165°F/74°C.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the hens to rest for 10 minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Rest and serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Cornish Game Hens, Cornish Hens

recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup bread crumbs ((or for Keto-crushed pork rinds, almond flour, etc.))
1 teaspoon dried herbs ((thyme, oregano, basil, rosemary, etc.))
marinara, ketchup, mustard, ranch, BBQ sauce, honey mustard sauce, hot sauce, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat air fryer at 400°F/205°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the zucchini lengthwise into wedges about 3/4-inch (2 cm) thick at the widest part. Cut them to desired fry length if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: In a shallow bowl, whisk eggs. In a second shallow bowl, combine Parmesan, bread crumbs, dried herbs, smoked paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine breading ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Dip zucchini strips in egg to coat all sides, then coat the zucchini with parmesan/breading mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat zucchini

recipeInstructions.text: Cook the zucchini in batches: Coat the air fryer basket/tray with oil spray or line with air fryer perforated silicone liner or perforated parchment paper. Lay zucchini fries in a single layer cut side up in air fryer basket/tray. Coat the zucchini fries with another coat of oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for 8-10 minutes. After cooking for 5 minutes, gently flip the zucchini fries and continue cooking for 3-5 minutes or until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Serve warm with your favorite sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Crispy, Fries, Zucchini, Zucchini Fries

If you’re cooking a thicker fish like halibut or cod, just add a few minutes extra cooking time. To avoid sticking and tearing of the fish, we like to use perforated parchment/baking paper made for air fryers.

recipeIngredient: 12 ounces tilapia filets (, or other white fish (2 filets-6 ounces each))
kosher salt ( or sea salt , to taste)
fresh cracked black pepper (, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat Air Fryer to 360°F for 5 minutes. Rinse and pat dry the fish filets. Spray or coat with olive oil spray and season with garlic powder, lemon pepper, and/or onion power, salt and pepper. Repeat for both sides.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: To help sticking, lay perforated air fryer baking paper inside base of air fryer. Lightly spray the paper. (if not using a liner, spray enough olive oil spray at the base of the air fryer basket to make sure fish does not stick)
recipeInstructions.name: Line with Parchment Paper

recipeInstructions.text: Lay the fish on top of the paper. Add a few lemon wedges next to fish.Air Fry at 360°F for about 6-12 minutes, or until fish can be flaked with a fork.  Timing will depend on how thickness of the filets, how cold the filets are, & individual preference. (optional) Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve warm with the toasted lemon wedges.

name: Air Fryer Frozen Curly Fries
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how curly fries cook. They all vary in size,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. For smaller air fryers (less than 5qt.) 1 pound is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. The more you fill the basket the more frequently you’ll want to shake the basket to help them cook evenly. If you have a larger air fryer, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch of fries, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These  were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

video.name: Air Fryer Frozen Curly Fries (No Oil Needed!) with Time & Temp.
video.description:
Full Recipe Here 👉 https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-frozen-curly-fries/

——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ————
Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk  

INGREDIENTS
1 lb. Frozen curly fries
salt , to taste
black pepper , to taste

INSTRUCTIONS
1. Place the frozen curly fries in the air fryer basket and spread out evenly. No oil spray is needed.
2. Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for 10 minutes. Shake and gently stir about halfway through cooking. If cooking larger batches, or if the curly fries don't cook evenly, try turning them multiple times on following batches.
3. If needed air fry at 400°F/205°C for an additional 1-4 minutes or until crisped to your liking. Season with salt & pepper, if desired.

Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition will vary depending on individual meatball types.

name: Air Fryer Rosemary Garlic Lamb Chops
description: Fragrant rosemary and garlic add so much flavor to these juicy lamb chops. Using air fryers that are at least 5 qt or larger will allow you to cook all the chops in one layer for the full batch. If you only have a small air fryer, you can cook these chops in 2-3 batches.

Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-lamb-chops-recipe/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1.25 lbs. rack of lamb (, about 7-8 chops)
1 teaspoon garlic powder ( or 3 cloves garlic, minced)
1/2 teaspoon black pepper (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Pat dry the lamb rack. Remove silver skin from underside of ribs if needed. Cut into individual chops.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut Lamb Chops

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine olive oil, rosemary, garlic, salt, & pepper. Add the lamb and gently toss to coat in marinade. Cover and marinate for about 1 hour or up to overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Marinade

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 380°F/195°C for 4 minutes. Spray air fryer basket/tray with oil spray and place lamb chops in a single layer, making sure not to overlap the meat.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 8 minutes, flip and air fry for another 3-6 minutes, or to your preferred doneness. Serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. lamb chops (, each cut about 1-inch thick (@4-5 chops))
1-2 pinches red pepper flakes (, or to taste)
1 Tablespoon lemon juice (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the chimichurri sauce: combine the olive oil, parsley, garlic, salt, black pepper, red pepper flakes, and lemon juice. Taste for seasoning. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Chimichurri Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the lamb chops with oil to lightly coat. Season lamb chops with smoked paprika, salt, and black pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Lamb Chops

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket/tray with oil spray and place lamb chops in a single layer, making sure not to overlap the meat.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer in Single Layer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 8 minutes, flip and continue Air Frying for another 4-8 minutes, or to your preferred doneness. Serve with chimichurri sauce on lamb chops.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

name: Air Fryer Pasta Chips
description: Make sure the pasta is cooked enough before air frying. We like our pasta cooked a little softer, then when it’s air fried it’s not so hard. If your pasta is too al dente, then after air frying it might end up hard and not crispy. Read our write up in the post about al dente pasta.
recipeIngredient: 8 oz. dried Bowtie ((Farfalle) Pasta, or pasta shape of choice)
1 Tablespoon Olive Oil or Vegetable Oil
1/2 teaspoon Kosher Salt (, or to taste)
Optional - additional seasonings of choice - Italian seasoning (, dried basil, onion powder, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot of salted boiling water, cook the pasta to package directions. Cook until it is tender (it crisps up best if it is cooked a little beyond al dente).
recipeInstructions.name: Boil Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the pasta and put in a bowl. Toss with the olive oil, garlic powder, parmesan cheese, and salt (it should be well seasoned).
recipeInstructions.name: Season Pasta

recipeInstructions.text: Cooking in batches if needed, put just a single layer of the seasoned pasta in the air fryer basket/tray. (For most air fryers, cook in batches to avoid overcrowding the basket/tray. For best results air fry in just a single layer.)
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer Basket

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 7-10 minutes, shaking and stirring the pasta every 2-3 minutes making sure to separate any pasta sticking together. (Shaking often helps them crispy evenly and not burnt.) Cook until the pasta is golden and crispy to your liking. Timing will vary depending on your air fryer model, type of pasta you’re cooking and preferred texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: If cooking in batches, the next batches might cook quicker because the air fryer is already hot. Serve with warmed marinara sauce or sauce of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with Sauce

keywords: Air Fryer, Chips, Pasta

name: Air Fryer Pizzas {w/ Pre-made Crusts}
description: Air frying time will vary depending on the thickness, type of dough, if there are any sugars added to the dough, and by different air fryer models. Adjust as needed. Toppings may fly off the pizzas, depending on how light they are and how strong your air fryer fan is. Use an air fryer rack to keep the toppings from flying off while air frying the pizzas (see photo in recipe steps).

recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup Pizza Sauce ( or tomato sauce)
Pepperoni, cooked Sausage, Bacon pieces, diced Ham, sliced or diced Tomatoes, Mushrooms, Pineapple, etc.
BBQ Sauce, Salsa, White (Alfredo) Sauce, Pesto, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the pizza crust in air fryer bottom side up (make sure it is in just a single layer - cook in batches if needed for multiple pizzas).
recipeInstructions.name: Place crust in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C about 3-5 minutes.  Flip the crust over. Continue to Air fry at 380°F/193°C for another 3-5 minutes (if you want the crust extra crispy - air fry each side a couple minutes more).
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry pizza crust

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the sauce over the pizza crust. Top with cheese and add additional salt, pepper and other preferred toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce and toppings

recipeInstructions.text: To keep your topping from flying around, place an air fryer rack over the pizza.
recipeInstructions.name: Add rack

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the pizzas at 380°F/193°C for 2-4 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the air fryer and allow to cool for a minute or two before eating.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Pizza from Pillsbury Canned Dough
description: Toppings may fly off the pizzas, depending on how light they are and how strong your air fryer fan is. Use an air fryer rack to keep the toppings from flying off while air frying the pizzas (see photo in recipe steps).
recipeIngredient: 1 can Pillsbury refrigerated canned Pizza Dough ((13.8 oz - 391g))
1/2 cup pizza sauce or tomato sauce
Pepperoni, cooked Sausage, Bacon pieces, diced Ham, sliced or diced Tomatoes, Mushrooms, Pineapple (, etc.)
BBQ Sauce, Salsa, White (Alfredo) Sauce, Pesto (, etc.)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut pizza dough to size of your air fryer basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut dough to size

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer base with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray air fryer base

recipeInstructions.text: Place dough in air fryer basket/tray.  Poke several holes in the dough with a fork.
recipeInstructions.name: Put dough in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the pizza dough at 360°F/182°C for 4-6 minutes.  Flip the dough over.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry then flip

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 3-5 minutes or until golden and dough is cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry again

recipeInstructions.text: Add sauce on top of pizza crust then add your toppings. To keep the toppings from flying around, place an air fryer accessory rack over the pizza.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce and toppings

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 2-5 minutes or until toppings are heated through and cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the pizza from the air fryer. Allow to cool enough to handle and cut into pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut and serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Canned Dough, Pizza

name: Air Fryer Pizzas from Raw Dough
description: This makes a 6-8" personal sized pizza. Raw dough can be a little more challenging than using pre-cooked crust, but can be extra delicious for those willing to try. If you want to use a pre-cooked crust, see our recipe here for Air Fryer Pizza with Pre-Cooked Crusts. Air frying time will vary depending how thick you make the crust, type of dough, if there are any sugars added to the dough, and by different air fryer models. Adjust as needed. Toppings may fly off the pizzas, depending on how light they are and how strong your air fryer fan is. Use an air fryer rack to keep the toppings from flying off while air frying the pizzas (see photo in recipe steps).
