recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup Pizza Sauce ( or tomato sauce)
Pepperoni, cooked Sausage, cooked Bacon pieces, cooked diced Ham, sliced or diced Tomatoes, Mushrooms, Pineapple, etc.
BBQ Sauce, Salsa, White (Alfredo) Sauce, Pesto, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat Air Fryer at 380°F/193°C for 4-5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: On a lightly floured surface, flatten and stretch the dough to round shape. Make sure dough is not too thin or it will tear, about 1/4-inch thick is best. Dust with a little more flour if needed to keep from sticking.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out dough

recipeInstructions.text: Spray oil air fryer basket or rack. Lay shaped dough on the basket/rack and poke a few holes in the dough with a fork.
recipeInstructions.name: Poke dough will holes

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for about 2-4 minutes. Flip the crust over.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry pizza crust

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for another 2-4 minutes until crust is lightly golden. (if you want the crust extra crispy - air fry each side a couple minutes more).
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and continue

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the sauce over the pizza crust. Top with cheese and preferred toppings. Spray top of pizza with light oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce and toppings

recipeInstructions.text: To keep your topping from flying around, place an air fryer rack over the pizza.
recipeInstructions.name: Add rack

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the pizzas at 380°F/193°C for 3-5 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the air fryer and allow to cool for a minute or two before eating.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Pizza

description: Flatten and air fry the biscuits before adding the sauce and toppings. Then add the sauce and toppings and continue to air fry to heat the toppings and melt the cheese.Toppings may fly off the pizzas, depending on how light they are and how strong your air fryer fan is. Use an air fryer rack to keep the toppings from flying off while air frying the pizzas (see photo in recipe steps).

recipeIngredient: 1 cup pizza sauce ( or tomato sauce)
Pepperoni, cooked Sausage, Bacon pieces, diced Ham, sliced or diced Tomatoes, Mushrooms, Pineapple, etc.
BBQ Sauce, Salsa, White (Alfredo) Sauce, Pesto, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Separate the biscuits, then flatten and roll out each biscuit to 5-inches (13cm) wide.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll out biscuit dough

recipeInstructions.text: Place in the air fryer basket/tray in a single layer (cook in batches if needed - do not top with sauce or toppings yet).
recipeInstructions.name: Place dough in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/166°C for 3 minutes.  Flip the biscuit dough over. Continue to Air Fry at 330°F/166°C for another 3-4 minutes, or until cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry dough

recipeInstructions.text: Spread about 2 Tablespoons of sauce over each biscuit dough base. Then sprinkle about 2 Tablespoons of cheese on top. Add additional salt, pepper and other desired toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce and toppings

recipeInstructions.text: Place the biscuit dough pizzas in the air fryer basket/tray in a single layer (cook in batches if needed). To keep your topping from flying around, place an air fryer rack over the pizzas.
recipeInstructions.name: Place pizza in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Increase the heat and Air Fry the pizzas at 360°F/182°C for 2-5 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

name: Air Fryer Turkey Melt
description: Add some leftover turkey and cheese for a delicious grille turkey melt. The cheese and crispy bread is a satisfying way to enjoy leftover Thanksgiving for lunch. To ensure that the bread doesn’t fly off during air frying, use a toothpick to secure the sandwich together. Make sure to remove the toothpick before eating!

name: Air Fryer Frozen Onion Rings
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how frozen onion rings cook. They all vary in size,  thickness, and sometimes the coating so you’ll have to adjust timing. For smaller air fryers (less than 5qt.) 1 pound is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. The more you fill the basket the more frequently you’ll want to shake the basket to help them cook evenly. If you have a larger air fryer, you can cook more so long as the basket isn’t filled more than 1/2 full. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch of onion rings, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen onion rings in the air fryer basket and spread out evenly. No oil spray is needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for 10 minutes. Shake and gently stir about halfway through cooking. If cooking larger batches, or if the onion rings don't cook evenly, try turning them multiple times on following batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: If needed air fry at 400°F/205°C for an additional 1-4 minutes or until crisped to your liking. Season with salt & pepper, if desired.

name: Air Fryer Pork Chop Bites with Mushrooms
description: If you don't like mushrooms, you can cook it with your favorite veggie. Just make sure they are cut small enough to cook around same time as the pork. The size you cut the pork cubes will vary and so will sizes of air fryers. These will all affect how quick the pork will cook. Keep checking and turning the pork to make sure they cook to your preferred doneness.

name: Air Fryer Garlic Parmesan Brussels Sprouts
description: Brussels sprouts range so much in size. Some are huge (size of a large egg) while others are more around the size of a quarter, others can be as small as a nickel. All these different sizes means different cooking times, so keep checking the Brussels during air frying so that you can cook them to your preferred texture. We like our Brussels a little more brown and crispy!

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. Brussels sprouts (, ends removed and cut in half)
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder ( or 2 cloves minced garlic)

recipeInstructions.text: Put Brussels sprouts in a large bowl. Evenly drizzle oil and add garlic salt/ minced garlic over Brussels sprouts. Add salt and pepper to taste. Toss the Brussels sprouts well to completely coat with the oil and garlic. There shouldn't be any oil left pooling at the bottom of the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Season Brussels sprouts

recipeInstructions.text: Add Brussels sprouts to the air fryer basket/tray. Spray tops of Brussels sprouts with additional light layer of oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 10 minutes. Gently stir.

Check regularly to make sure they don't burn. Or cook 1-2 minutes longer if needed to get everything crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir and continue cooking

recipeInstructions.text: Put Brussels sprouts into a serving bowl and immediately add parmesan on top of hot Brussels sprouts.
recipeInstructions.name: Add parmesan

recipeInstructions.text: Cover the bowl with foil for a minute or two to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the cheese

recipeInstructions.text: Season with additional salt and pepper if needed. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Crispy Air Fryer Roasted Brussels Sprouts
description: You can also par-boil them first, drain and then continue with the air frying recipe method. Par boiling helps make them a little softer and more cooked through the center. Cooking times will vary depending on the size of brussels sprouts. We like our brussels sprouts brown, crispy and tender. For small to medium brussels sprouts, cut them in half. If they’re larger, then cut them into thirds. Most importantly, try to buy them in all the same size for consistent cooking. We used a 3.7 qt air fryer.

recipeIngredient: 1 pound brussels sprouts (, ends removed and cut into bite-sized pieces)
3 Tablespoons olive oil (, or less if you have less brussels sprouts )

recipeInstructions.text: Add brussels sprouts in a large bowl.  Evenly drizzle oil and balsamic vinegar over brussels sprouts. Add salt & pepper to taste. Toss the brussels sprouts well to completely coat with the oil and balsamic vinegar. Make sure to toss well to coat all the brussels sprouts. There shouldn't be any liquid left pooling at the bottom of the bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Add brussels sprouts in a large bowl.  Evenly drizzle oil and balsamic vinegar over brussels sprouts. Add salt & pepper to taste. Toss the brussels sprouts well to completely coat with the oil and balsamic vinegar. Make sure to toss well to coat all the brussels sprouts. There shouldn't be any liquid left pooling at the bottom of the bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently add the brussels sprouts to the air fryer basket or rack. Air fry at 360°F for about 15-20 minutes, depending on size of brussels sprouts. Shake and gently stir half way through, about 8 minutes into cooking. Make sure you shake at the halfway mark! You don’t want to end up with uneven cooking. Continue to air fry the brussels for the remainder of the time, or until the brussels are golden brown and cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently add the brussels sprouts to the air fryer basket or rack. Air fry at 360°F for about 15-20 minutes, depending on size of brussels sprouts. Shake and gently stir half way through, about 8 minutes into cooking. Make sure you shake at the halfway mark! You don’t want to end up with uneven cooking. Continue to air fry the brussels for the remainder of the time, or until the brussels are golden brown and cooked through.

recipeInstructions.text: TIP: Check earlier if needed to make sure brussels sprouts don't burn or shake/toss more often for even cooking (about 3 times). Or cook a little longer if needed to get everything crispy .
recipeInstructions.name: TIP: Check earlier if needed to make sure brussels sprouts don't burn or shake/toss more often for even cooking (about 3 times). Or cook a little longer if needed to get everything crispy .

recipeInstructions.text: Season with extra salt and pepper if needed on the brussels sprouts. Well seasoned brussels are extra tasty. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Season with extra salt and pepper if needed on the brussels sprouts. Well seasoned brussels are extra tasty. Enjoy!

name: Air Fryer Nashville Hot Chicken Hack
description: Different brands of frozen breaded chicken breasts cook differently. They all vary in size, thickness, type and heaviness of the breading so you’ll have to adjust timing. For best and even cooking, don't overcrowd the basket and cook the chicken in a single layer. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.
recipeIngredient: About 2-4 frozen pre-cooked breaded chicken breasts
1 Tablespoon ground cayenne pepper (, or 2 Tablespoons for extra hot)
1 Tablespoon Worcestershire sauce or soy sauce
Pickles (, whatever you prefer - bread & butter, dill, or both)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Sauce: Combine all the sauce ingredients in a bowl or saucepan (butter, oil, cayenne pepper, brown sugar, garlic powder, paprika, Worcestershire or soy sauce, salt and pepper). Microwave or heat until butter is just melted (the hotter it is, the harder it will be to emulsify the spices in the liquids). Whisk thoroughly until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine Sauce Ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: When the sauce is cooler, it doesn’t separate as easily so we like to brush sauce on the chicken when the sauce is slightly cooler or room temperature. If you want your sauce warmer, then keep stirring or whisking the sauce as you brush the chicken so that you have as little separation of sauce/oil as possible. The warmer the sauce is, the more the spices will want to separate from the liquids.
recipeInstructions.name: Whisk together

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen breaded chicken breasts in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Make sure they aren't overlapping. No oil spray is needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 10 minutes. Flip the chicken over.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for another 2 minutes. Check the chicken breasts and if needed, add another 2-3 minutes or until heated through and crispy to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and finish cooking

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken on top of white bread. Brush both sides of chicken with the hot sauce. Top with pickles and serve warm. Enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken on top of white bread. Brush both sides of chicken with the hot sauce. Top with pickles and serve warm. Enjoy!

keywords: Air Fryer, Breaded, Chicken, Frozen, Hot Chicken Hack, Nashville Hot Chicken

name: Air Fryer Chicken Parmesan
description: Adjust cooking time for thicker or thinner chicken. Some brands of Air Fryers will cook slower or faster than others, adjust accordingly. We cooked the chicken in a 3-4 qt. Air Fryer. For that size of air fryer, 2-3 chicken breasts is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. If you have larger size, you can probably cook 2-3 more so long as they are still in a single layer.

video.name: Air Fryer Chicken Parmesan with Time & Temp.

recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 lbs. boneless skinless chicken breasts ((2 breasts))
3/4 cup bread crumbs (, or as needed)
1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (, or as needed)
2 cups marinara sauce or tomato sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the chicken dry. Cut the chicken breasts in half, lengthwise. Pound the chicken breasts into thinner pieces. This will make sure the chicken cooks all the way through. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together the breadcrumbs and parmesan cheese in a medium bowl.  In another bowl, beat the egg(s) (amount of eggs will depend on size of chicken - start with one and add an extra if needed) and set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make coating

recipeInstructions.text: Dip each piece of chicken in egg and then dredge it in the breadcrumb/cheese mixture. Shake off any excess bread crumb coating. Repeat with the remaining pieces of chicken. Spray both sides of coated chicken with cooking spray right before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat chicken with breading

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken breasts in single layer inside air fryer basket. Spray any dry spots with oil if needed. If using smaller air fryer basket, you will need to cook in batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer and spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for about 6-8 minutes. Flip the chicken breasts and top the chicken with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Air fry the sauced and cheese chicken breasts for another 1-3 minutes or until sauce is heated through and cheese it melted to your preference. Garnish with optional parsley and serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Sauce and air fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken Parmesan

name: Air Fryer Chicken Strips {Crispy}
description: We love using the crispy, flakiness of Panko for the chicken strips. There are also so many other options for the breading that come out crispy and accommodate different dietary choices (breadcrumbs, gluten-free breadcrumbs or Panko, almond flour, crushed pork rinds, etc). We love them all, each giving slightly different texture and flavor.Several factors will influence how the chicken strips cook. The size and thickness, the breading you use, your brand or model of air fryer, etc. Adjust timing as needed. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food.Make sure to spray the tenders to completely coat all the dry spots of breading or else is may cook up dry and crunchy instead of crispy. Want to know what oils and sprayers are best for an air fryer? Check out our write up on What are the Best Oils and Pump Sprays for Air Frying.

video.name: Air Fryer Homemade Crispy Chicken Tenders
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chicken-strips/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk INGREDIENTS 1 pound (454 g) chicken tenders , or boneless skinless chicken breast, tenders, or thighs 1-2 cups (240-480 ml) breading of choice - breadcrumbs, panko, crushed pork rinds or almond flour 2 large eggs 1 teaspoon (5 ml) kosher salt , to taste 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) black pepper , to taste 1 teaspoon (5 ml) garlic powder 1 teaspoon (5 ml) paprika Cooking Spray Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chicken-strips/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 pound chicken tenders (, or boneless skinless chicken breast, tenders, or thighs)
1-2 cups Panko ( - or breading of choice-breadcrumbs, crushed pork rinds, almond flour, etc)
1/2 teaspoon black pepper (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 370°F/188°C for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: If not using tenders, cut the chicken into strips. Make sure they are evenly sized. The thicker they are, the longer they will take to cook.
recipeInstructions.name: Cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the seasonings (salt, pepper, garlic powder and paprika). Season the chicken strips with the spices. Put the Panko (or breading of choice) in a bowl large enough to dredge the chicken. In another bowl, beat the eggs until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Season chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Coat the chicken cutlets strips in egg, then in the Panko (or breading of choice). Press chicken strips into the Panko so that it sticks and completely coats the chicken. Repeat for all chicken pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Bread the chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Generously spray both all sides of all the coated chicken with oil spray to coat all dry spots. If you have air fryer parchment sheets or a perforated silicone mat, lay one in the air fryer basket. Lay the coated chicken strips in a single layer, don’t overlap them.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 370°F/190°C for 6 minutes. Gently flip the tenders and lightly spray any dry spots. Continue to air fry for another 2-8 minutes (depending on the size and thickness of your tenders), or until they are crispy brown or internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F/74°C. ??Serve chicken strips with your favorite dip: ketchup, mustard, bbq sauce, etc.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken Strips, Chicken Tenders, Homemade, Panko

name: Air Fryer “Shake ’n Bake” Style Chicken
description: The boxes say to moisten the chicken first and we added more options to do this: ice water, milk, egg or mayo.Chicken drumsticks, thighs, breasts, tenders and legs are all different so cooking times will vary depending on the size, thickness. Once you make your first batch in your specific air fryer, you'll know exactly what time and temp works best for your personal taste. If cooking different cuts of chicken, the tenders/strips and small drumsticks will always cook quicker. So remove those first if you’re also cooking other thicker cuts of chicken.

(910 g) chicken drumsticks or thighs (4 drumsticks or 2 thighs per pound size) Ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo , to moisten the pork Shake ’n Bake Style Seasoned Coating Mix Oil spray , to coat the pork chops ? recipeIngredient: 2 lbs. chicken drumsticks or thighs ( (4 drumsticks or 2 thighs per pound size))
Ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo (, to moisten the chicken)
1 cup Shake ’n Bake Style Seasoned Coating Mix ((approximately))
Oil spray (, to coat the chicken)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat Air Fryer at 360°F/180°C for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Moisten the chicken based on the seasoned coating mix instructions (or by using ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo). Coat with the seasoned coating mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat Chicken

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket/tray with oil or place a perforated parchment sheet in the air fryer basket/tray & lightly coat with oil spray (this helps keep the chicken coating from sticking & coming off).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray & Line Air Fryer Basket

recipeInstructions.text: Place the coated chicken in a single layer (cook in batches if needed). Make sure chicken is not touching or the coating may flake off when you flip them. Lightly coat the chicken with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place chicken in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for about 25-35 minutes, flipping half way. Chicken thighs need about 5-8 minutes additional cooking time to cook completely through. Lightly spray any dry spots and then continue Air Frying for the remaining time or until they are crispy brown or until internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry Chicken

name: Healthy Air Fryer Herbed Chicken Breast
description: Cooking time will vary depending on thickness of the chicken breasts & different air fryer models. Read more air frying notes below.

video.name: Air Fryer Herb Chicken Breast with Time & Temp.
video.description:

🖨 Print Full Recipe Here 👉  https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chicken-breast-recipe/

recipeIngredient: 2  boneless, skinless chicken breasts ((about 8 ounces (227g) each))
oil spray or olive oil (, to coat chicken)
1/2 teaspoon dried herb seasoning  ((basil, thyme, oregano, etc. - whatever you like best or any preferred seasoning))

recipeInstructions.text: Pat dry the chicken breasts.  For thicker chicken breasts, cut several 1/2" deep slits in the chicken so it will cook through to the middle better. Coat each chicken breast with oil, then season with dried herbs, salt, & pepper. Place the chicken in the air fryer basket or rack in a single layer.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat dry the chicken breasts.  For thicker chicken breasts, cut several 1/2" deep slits in the chicken so it will cook through to the middle better. Coat each chicken breast with oil, then season with dried herbs, salt, & pepper. Place the chicken in the air fryer basket or rack in a single layer.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F(195°C) for 14-18 minutes, turning the chicken over halfway through cooking. Air fry the chicken until the internal temp is 165°F (75°C) in the thickest part.  If you’re cooking bone-in chicken breast, cook for additional 2-6 minutes, if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 380°F(195°C) for 14-18 minutes, turning the chicken over halfway through cooking. Air fry the chicken until the internal temp is 165°F (75°C) in the thickest part.  If you’re cooking bone-in chicken breast, cook for additional 2-6 minutes, if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the chicken breast to rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve while warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Allow the chicken breast to rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve while warm.

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken

name: Air Fryer Brown Sugar & Honey Glazed Ham
description: Bring the ham to room temp before air frying. Otherwise the ham may still be too cold in the center after cooking. Our 3 pound boneless ham was cooked in a 6qt. Air fryer. If your air fryer is smaller and you’re cooking with a smaller ham, adjust cooking times. Don't let the foil touch the heating elements of the air fryer. If it touches, then your ham is too large for your air fryer. Trim down the bottom of the ham so it isn't too tall. We estimate about 15-20 minutes per pound for air frying the ham.

video.name: Air Fryer Ham with Brown Sugar Glaze with Time & Temp
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-honey-baked-ham/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py INGREDIENTS 3 pounds boneless, fully cooked ham (at room temp) BROWN SUGAR GLAZE 1/2 cup brown sugar 1/4 cup honey 1/4 cup orange juice (or 1 orange juiced) 2 Tablespoons mustard (optional) or apple cider vinegar 1/4 teaspoon Cinnamon 1/4 teaspoon Clove black pepper , to taste ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-honey-baked-ham/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 2 Tablespoons mustard ((optional) or apple cider vinegar)

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the ham from the fridge and allow to come up to room temperature, about 2 hours before cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to room temp.

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Glaze: In a small saucepan or microwave safe bowl, combine the brown sugar & honey glaze ingredients (brown sugar, honey, orange juice, optional mustard or apple cider vinegar, cinnamon, clove, and black pepper). Heat (can be done on the stovetop or in the microwave) and whisk until brown sugar is dissolved and glaze is well combined. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: If the ham has a netting, remove it from the ham. If ham is not pre-sliced, score the ham with shallow 1/2-inch criss-cross cuts.
recipeInstructions.name: Score Ham

recipeInstructions.text: For Basket Style Air Fryers: Line the air fryer basket with 2 pieces of long, overlapping foil sheets (see step-by step photos on website write up above). Lay the ham on top of the foil and then brush with some of the glaze to coat the ham. Close the foil over the ham and wrap tightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in Air Fryer Basket

recipeInstructions.text: For Oven Style Air Fryers: Place the ham in an 8”x8” baking pan which fits in your air fryer (you may need to trim the edges of the ham to fit your pan and air fryer size). Brush with some of the glaze and close foil over the ham, wrapping tightly.
recipeInstructions.name: For Oven Style Air Fryers: Place the ham in an 8”x8” baking pan which fits in your air fryer (you may need to trim the edges of the ham to fit your pan and air fryer size). Brush with some of the glaze and close foil over the ham, wrapping tightly.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 25 minutes. Open the foil and brush the ham with more glaze (make sure to reserve some glaze for finishing & serving). Close the foil tightly, and Air Fry again at 340°/170°C for 25 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: After air frying for the 50 minutes, open up the foil again and now push the foil down around the edges of the ham if using the basket-style air fryer method.  Create a boat with the foil that holds the juices and keeps the ham from drying out.  If using the Oven Style Air Fryer method, just remove the foil from the 8"x8" pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: Brush with a little more glaze and increase heat to Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for about 5 minutes, or until caramelized to your liking.
recipeInstructions.name: Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: Let ham rest for 5 minutes before serving.Optional serving: Combine the juices from the air fryer basket and the remaining glaze in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Brush the glaze onto the ham when serving or serve in a bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Brown Sugar Glaze, Ham, Holiday, Honey

name: Easy 3-Ingredient AIR FRYER Bagels
description: Shaping the dough takes a little patience because it's soft. But if they're not "perfect" looking don't worry. They'll still be delicious! THICK YOGURT: The dough will be soft and sticky to work with so try to use a thick greek yogurt. Avoid “greek-style” yogurt which tends to be much thinner.  Our brand suggestions are below in notes. SOFT DOUGH: Be prepared to work with soft dough and be patient while molding the dough to shape. If dough is too soft, add a little more flour. If too dry, add a little more yogurt.  Try not to over knead the dough or else it will make the bagels tough. It is better to have it a little more rustic looking and tender bagel than a perfectly smooth and tough bagel. FLOURS: This recipe can easily be doubled and uses self rising flour, which has baking powder and salt already. If using all-purpose flour, you must mix about 2 teaspoons baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon of salt to the flour prior to mixing with the yogurt.

video.name: Air Fryer Homemade Bagels (Easy 3-Ingredients) with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-bagels-recipe/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 1 cup plain, thick non-fat greek yogurt 1 cup self rising flour , *if using all purpose flour, see note above. OPTIONAL TOP INGREDIENTS: 1 large egg , beaten * read note (optional) bagel toppings: Sesame seeds, pre-mixed bagel seasonings, poppy seeds, cheddar cheese, sliced jalapeños. ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-bagels-recipe/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/ SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 cup plain, thick non-fat greek yogurt
1 cup self rising flour (, *if using all purpose flour, see note above.)
(optional) bagel toppings: Sesame seeds, pre-mixed bagel seasonings, poppy seeds, cheddar cheese, sliced jalapeños.

recipeInstructions.text: Drain yogurt of excess liquid before you measure it out. Combine yogurt and flour until all the flour is mixed into the yogurt and dough forms a ball.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain yogurt of excess liquid before you measure it out. Combine yogurt and flour until all the flour is mixed into the yogurt and dough forms a ball.

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle a light layer of flour on a cutting board. Knead the dough for about 30 seconds. Cut the dough into 4 equal parts. If dough is sticky lightly flour your hands. Don’t add too much flour or the dough will become tough.
recipeInstructions.name: Sprinkle a light layer of flour on a cutting board. Knead the dough for about 30 seconds. Cut the dough into 4 equal parts. If dough is sticky lightly flour your hands. Don’t add too much flour or the dough will become tough.

recipeInstructions.text: Roll each dough piece into a ball. Lightly flour your finger, then poke it in the center of the dough ball to create a hole. Look at the step by step photos on the website. These photos are helpful.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll each dough piece into a ball. Lightly flour your finger, then poke it in the center of the dough ball to create a hole. Look at the step by step photos on the website. These photos are helpful.

recipeInstructions.text: Gently stretch out the center hole to be about 1” wide opening and shape the the dough into a bagel shape.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently stretch out the center hole to be about 1” wide opening and shape the the dough into a bagel shape.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush egg over the bagels. If adding seeds, sprinkle seeds or seasonings on top of bagels.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush egg over the bagels. If adding seeds, sprinkle seeds or seasonings on top of bagels.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket or tray with oil to make sure bagel doesn’t stick while cooking (you can also use air fryer parchment sheets).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray air fryer basket or tray with oil to make sure bagel doesn’t stick while cooking (you can also use air fryer parchment sheets).

recipeInstructions.text: Gently place bagels in your air fryer, leaving enough room between the bagels for the to expand. Don’t crowd the basket or rack. Cook the bagels in batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Gently place bagels in your air fryer, leaving enough room between the bagels for the to expand. Don’t crowd the basket or rack. Cook the bagels in batches.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F for about 10-14 minutes, or until bagels are golden and cooked in the center.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 330°F for about 10-14 minutes, or until bagels are golden and cooked in the center.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with cream cheese or make an awesome bagel sandwich out of it.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with cream cheese or make an awesome bagel sandwich out of it.

keywords: Air Fryer, Bagels, Homemade

name: Air Fryer Sweet Potato Chips
description: Should you soak the sweet potato slices in water first to remove the starch? We tested this several times in different air fryers and did not see a difference in results from soaking. In fact, we found that not soaking them in water saved time and it made cooking times quicker. The potato chips were still crunchy and delicious. But some people swear by the soaking method. We added the soaking technique in the recipe too so you can have both options. See more recipe NOTES below.

video.name: Air Fryer Sweet Potato Chips
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https:/airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-sweet-potato-chips/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the OXO Mandoline (updated version): https://amzn.to/2WIKL2q Get Cut Resistant Gloves: https://amzn.to/38C4Ahs INGREDIENTS 1 medium sweet potato about 1 Tablespoon (30ml) oil spray salt , to taste pepper , to taste optional: ground cumin , garlic powder or onion powder or paprika ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-sweet-potato-chips/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: optional: ground cumin (, garlic powder or onion powder or paprika)

recipeInstructions.text: Slice sweet potato into 1/8” thin slices. (A mandoline with cut-resistant gloves makes this step quick & even). Discard the small end pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice Sweet Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Optional - Add sweet potato slices to bowl of cold water for at least 20 minutes. Remove and pat dry with towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak slices

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat Air Fryer at 340°F/170°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Place sweet potato slices in a bowl and spray with oil, season with salt, pepper or optional spices. Toss to evenly coat all sides with the oil and seasonings.
recipeInstructions.name: Season slices

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket/tray with oil to minimize sticking. Lay slices in single layer, trying to not overlap.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Initial Browning: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 10 minutes. Flip and separate any touching slices.Continue to Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 3-5 minutes increments or until they start to crisp on the edges. Separate the slices so they don’t stick together and this helps the chips crisp on both sides. Look for crispy brown sides because this is what makes them crunchy. But don’t let them burn. Check out our photos for reference.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Finishing: When you see crisp brown edges, reduce heat to 280°F/140°C and Air Fry for another 2-5 minutes or until they are dry. The chips will become crunchier when they are completely cool.If some of the chips are a still little chewy, then remove the crunchy ones and continue to Air Fry the chewy chips at 280°F/140°C for another 3 minutes or until crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish Air Frying

keywords: Air Fryer, Potato Chips, Sweet Potato

name: Air Fryer Tuna Patties
description: Avoid the canned tunas which are very mushy. Canned albacore tuna is our favorite for this recipe. Fresh, raw tuna works great too if you feel like using fresh fish and fits your budget. The amount of egg will vary depending on the dryness of your tuna and the absorption of the bread crumbs. If you are unsure, start with 2 eggs, and if the mixture seems too dry to easily form into patties, add a 3rd egg.

video.name: Air Fryer Tuna Patties with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-tuna-patties/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get our Favorite Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk INGREDIENTS 15 ounces canned albacore tuna , drained or 1 pound (454g) fresh tuna, diced 2-3 large eggs *see note above zest of 1 medium lemon 1 Tablespoon lemon juice 1/2 cup bread crumbs 3 Tablespoons grated parmesan cheese 1 stalk celery , finely chopped 3 Tablespoons minced onion 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder 1/2 teaspoon dried herbs (oregano, dill, basil, thyme or any combo) 1/4 teaspoon Kosher salt , or to taste fresh cracked black pepper optional for serving - ranch, tarter sauce, mayo, lemon slices ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-tuna-patties/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 15 ounces canned albacore tuna (, drained or 1 pound (454g) fresh tuna, diced)
1/2 cup bread crumbs (or crushed pork rinds for keto/low carb)
1/2 teaspoon dried herbs ((oregano, dill, basil, thyme or any combo))
1/4 teaspoon Kosher salt (, or to taste)
optional for serving - ranch, tarter sauce, mayo, lemon slices

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine the eggs, lemon zest, lemon juice, bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, celery, onion, garlic powder, dried herbs, salt and pepper. Stir to make sure everything is combined. Gently fold in the tuna until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine ingredients

recipeInstructions.text: Try to keep all patties same size and thickness for even cooking. Scoop 1/4 cup of mixture, and shape into patties about 3-inches wide x 1/2-inch thick and lay inside basket. Makes about 10 patties.
recipeInstructions.name: Form patties

recipeInstructions.text: If patties are too soft to handle, chill them for at about 1 hour or until firm. This will make them easier to handle during cooking. Spray or brush top of patties with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray with oil

recipeInstructions.text: If you have air fryer perforated baking paper or perforated silicone mats, they are great for this recipe. Lay perforated air fryer baking paper or perforated silicone mat inside base of air fryer. Lightly spray the paper or mat. (if not you don't have the liners, spray enough olive oil spray at the base of the air fryer basket to make sure the patties do not stick)
recipeInstructions.name: Line air fryer base

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F for 6 minutes. Flip the patties and spray the tops again with oil. Continue to Air Fry for another 3-5 minutes or until cooked to your preference.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with your favorite sauce and lemon slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Canned Tuna, Seafood, Tuna Patties

name: Homemade Corn Bread for Oven-Style Air Fryer
description: We have two recipes for two different style air fryers. A full 8” square baking pan can be cooked in most oven style air fryers. It will also fit in some of the larger basket-style air fryers, depending on the shape and sides of your pan and the dimensions of your air fryer basket. In the following recipe box, we have a small batch recipe for basket style air fryers that can accommodate an accessory cake bucket pan with handle.

video.name: Air Fryer Homemade Corn Bread
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-cornbread-recipe/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs Get our Favorite Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv or https://amzn.to/39tvt9l INGREDIENTS 1 cup (160 g) cornmeal 1 cup (125 g) all-purpose flour 2/3 cup (135 g) sugar 1 teaspoon (5 ml) salt , or to taste 1 Tablespoon (15 ml) baking powder 1 large egg 1 cup (256 g) creamed corn 1/3 cup (80 ml) vegetable oil ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-cornbread-recipe/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, stir to combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, salt, baking powder. Add egg, creamed corn, and oil. Stir until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix batter

recipeInstructions.text: Coat a 8x8 inch square baking pan with oil spray. Optional - cut and oil a piece of parchment paper to fit the bottom of your pan for easier release. Pour batter into baking pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil pan

recipeInstructions.text: Place baking pan on the lower rack in the air fryer. Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 25-30 minutes. Insert a toothpick in center of corn bread and when it comes out clean, it’s done. If after 30 minutes the toothpick isn’t fully clean yet but the edges of the cornbread are crisp, then turn off the heat and leave corn bread in the air fryer for about 10 minutes to allow the residual heat to continue cooking the corn bread.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to cool in the pan. It will release from the sides as it cools, making it easier to cut. Serve with honey, butter, or jam.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fryer, Corn Bread, Cornbread

name: Air Fryer Jiffy Corn Muffins
description: This popular brand of corn muffins is a quick and easy way to enjoy a small batch in the air fryer. It’s a great tasting corn muffin that’s both economical and perfect for small servings.

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the corn muffin mix, egg and milk. Mix just enough so that there are no dry spots and egg is fully incorporated. Do not over-mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix batter

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat interior of 6 silicone muffin cups with oil spray and fill about 2/3rds full with the batter. Use standard sized silicone muffin cups (not mini & not jumbo - the same size silicone muffins cups that we suggest in the write up).
recipeInstructions.name: Fill Muffin Cups

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 325°F for 7-9 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center. If the toothpick isn’t fully clean yet and muffins are slightly raw in the middle, then turn off the heat and leave muffins in the air fryer for about 5-10 minutes to allow the residual heat to continue cooking the interior of the corn muffins.

name: Air Fryer Green Bean Casserole with Toasted Fried Onions
description: This recipe is for air fryers large enough to fit a 7" Bucket-style Baking Pan. For oven-style air fryers we recommend using an 8" baking dish. The secret is air frying the fresh green beans first, then finishing off the last cooking step in the cream mixture. Top it off with some fried onions and you have a great side dish to share.

recipeIngredient: 14 oz. cream of mushroom soup ((1 can))
Optional - salt (, to taste - depending on seasoning of your cream of mushroom soup)

recipeInstructions.text: Cut green beans into bite sized pieces. Place in an 8" baking dish or a 7" Bucket-style Baking Pan, whichever fits your air fryer best (we recommend the baking dish for oven style air fryers, and at the bucket with the handles for the basket style air fryers). Spray green beans with oil. Place the baking dish in the air fryer middle rack or basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep green beans

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 12 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking *see note below recipe. If needed, stir 3 times during cooking and continue cooking until the green beans are to your preferred texture.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup, milk, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder and black pepper. Taste for seasoning and add salt or other seasonings if needed. Pour over the air fried green beans and gently stir.
recipeInstructions.name: Make sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 11-13 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking. Cook green beans until tender and sauce is bubbly.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Top with the fried onions, then cheese and Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 1-2 minutes or until the cheese is melted.
recipeInstructions.name: Add toppings

name: Air Fryer Steak Tips
description: If you want, you can cook the steak tips just by themselves. Or add mushrooms, asparagus or what ever veggies you like. But if you want to serve with potatoes: cut potatoes into pieces about half the size of the steak bites for them to cook to the best texture. We prefer using pee-wee or baby gold potatoes and then cutting them in half or quarters. Keto friendly version: you can cook the steak tips without potatoes or with other keto-friendly veggies.For the types of steak, use your favorite. Depending on the budget, we prefer ribeye, sirloin, tri-tip, and chuck shoulder steaks (aka London Broil steaks).
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. steaks (, cut into 1/2” pieces & patted dry)

recipeInstructions.text: If cooking potatoes, par boil the cut potatoes for about 5 minutes, or until nearly tender. Drain the potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: If cooking potatoes, par boil the cut potatoes for about 5 minutes, or until nearly tender. Drain the potatoes.

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine the steak tips and potatoes. Toss together with the melted butter, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: In bowl, combine the steak tips and potatoes. Toss together with the melted butter, Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the steak a good sear.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the steak a good sear.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the steak and potatoes in an even layer in the air fryer basket. Air fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the steak and potatoes 2 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the steak, and size of air fryer).
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the steak and potatoes in an even layer in the air fryer basket. Air fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the steak and potatoes 2 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the steak, and size of air fryer).

recipeInstructions.text: Check the steak to see how well done it is cooked. If you want the steak more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time.
recipeInstructions.name: Check the steak to see how well done it is cooked. If you want the steak more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time.

recipeInstructions.text: (optional) Garnish with parsley, optional melted butter drizzled on,  and/or optional chili flakes.  Season with additional salt & pepper if desired. Serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: (optional) Garnish with parsley, optional melted butter drizzled on,  and/or optional chili flakes.  Season with additional salt & pepper if desired. Serve warm.

We suggest cooking them slightly “crisper” or more golden brown on on the outside to make sure the biscuits are cooked all the way through. name: Air Fryer Whole Turkey with Gravy
description: Make sure your turkey is fully thawed on the inside. If not, it won’t cook properly. Your turkey will still be raw on the inside if it's cooked slightly frozen! Cooking times will vary depending on size of turkey. Whole, thawed turkey usually cooks at a rate of 15 min./lb. Use an instant read thermometer! Gravy recipe makes about 4 cups of gravy.

video.name: Air Fryer Whole Roast Turkey with Gravy with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-whole-turkey/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Big Boss Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3fQee33 Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 14 lb. raw Whole Turkey 6 Tablespoons butter , cut into slices 4 cloves garlic , sliced thin 1 Tablespoon kosher salt , or to taste black pepper , to taste Oil , to coat turkey 1 1/2 cups chicken broth 3/4 cup all purpose flour (for the gravy) INSTRUCTIONS 1. Thaw your turkey completely on the inside cavity. Remove and giblets and neck bones from the turkey cavity (many times the giblet pack will be tucked under the skin by the neck). Pat the turkey dry. 2. Tuck the butter slices and garlic in-between the skin and the turkey breasts. Oil the turkey and season with salt and pepper. 3. Place the lower rack in the air fryer and spray with oil. Place the turkey breast side down in the air fryer. Pour in 1/2 cup of broth over the turkey. Place the extender ring and lid on the air fryer. 4. Air Fry the turkey at 350°F for about 2 1/2 to 3 hours. 5. Every 30 minutes, baste with chicken broth (the first 2 bastes will be with the remaining broth. After that, baste from the broth & juices at the bottom of the air fryer). 6. After cooking for 2 hours, take off the air fryer lid and extender ring. Lift the turkey out, flip to breast side up, and then place back into the air fryer. Baste the turkey and then place the extender ring and lid back on 7. Continue to Air Fry at 350°F until the turkey reaches an internal temperature of 165°F at the thickest parts of the thigh, wings and breast, and the juices run clear when you cut between the leg and the thigh (about 30 minutes - 1 hour). 8. Let rest for about 15-20 minutes. 9. While the turkey rests, make the gravy. Remove the lower rack from the air fryer. Leaving the turkey juices and broth in the air fryer, skim the chunks from the drippings and broth. 10. Place flour in a medium bowl. Ladle in about 1 cup of the drippings and broth into the flour and whisk until smooth. Pour the flour mixture into the air fryer basket with the remaining drippings and broth. Whisk until smooth. 11. Place the air fryer lid back on and Air Fry at 400°F for 10 minutes or until thickened, whisking a couple times while cooking. ? recipeIngredient: 1 Tablespoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
Olive Oil ((or oil of choice),  to coat turkey)
3/4 cup all purpose flour ((for the gravy))

recipeInstructions.text: Thaw your turkey completely on the inside cavity. Remove and giblets and neck bones from the turkey cavity (many times the giblet pack will be tucked under the skin by the neck). Pat the turkey dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Pat turkey dry

recipeInstructions.text: Tuck the butter slices and garlic in-between the skin and the turkey breasts. Rub olive oil over the turkey and season with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season turkey

recipeInstructions.text: Place the lower rack in the air fryer and spray with oil. Place the turkey breast side down in the air fryer. Pour in 1/2 cup of broth over the turkey.  Place the extender ring and lid on the air fryer.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in air fryer breast down

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the turkey at 350°F for about 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Every 30 minutes, baste with chicken broth (the first 2 bastes will be with the remaining broth. After that, baste from the broth & juices at the bottom of the air fryer).
recipeInstructions.name: Baste

recipeInstructions.text: After cooking for 2 hours, take off the air fryer lid and extender ring. Lift the turkey out, flip to breast side up, and then place back into the air fryer. Baste the turkey and then place the extender ring and lid back on
recipeInstructions.name: Flip

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry at 350°F until the turkey reaches an internal temperature of 165°F at the thickest parts of the thigh, wings and breast, and the juices run clear when you cut between the leg and the thigh (about 30 minutes - 1 hour).
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Let rest for about 15-20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Rest

recipeInstructions.text: While the turkey rests, make the gravy. Remove the lower rack from the air fryer. Leaving the turkey juices and broth in the air fryer, skim the chunks from the drippings and broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Skim drippings

recipeInstructions.text: Place flour in a medium bowl. Ladle in about 1 cup of the drippings and broth into the flour and whisk until smooth. Pour the flour mixture into the air fryer with the remaining drippings and broth. Whisk until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Make gravy

recipeInstructions.text: Place the air fryer lid back on and Air Fry at 400°F for 10 minutes or until thickened, whisking a couple times while cooking.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook gravy

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Gravy, Holiday Main Dish, Thanksgiving, Whole Turkey

Remove the basket from the cooker and let rest for about 15-20 minutes. Remove the turkey from the basket, carve and serve. recipeIngredient: 1 Tablespoon kosher salt (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Remove and giblets and neck bones from the turkey cavity (many times the giblet pack will be tucked under the skin by the neck). Pat the turkey dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep turkey

recipeInstructions.text: Tuck the butter slices and garlic in-between the skin and the turkey breasts. Season the turkey with salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season turkey

recipeInstructions.text: Oil the basket to help prevent any sticking. Place the turkey (legs side down) in the basket. Insert the meat thermometer into the breast so that the tip doesn't touch bone and the dial is easily read when the basket is in the cooker. Place the basket in the Oil-Less Deep Fryer.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in oil-less deep fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Turn on the cooker to medium high cooking and cook for about 10 minutes per pound (14lbs.= approx. 140 minutes or 2 hrs 20 minutes). Occasionally spray with oil for crispiest skin. (Cover with the wire mesh lid during the last 15 minutes for the crispiest skin, it reflects heat back intowards the turkey. But if used the whole cook time, this heat can burn food before it is fully cooked.)
recipeInstructions.name: Cook

recipeInstructions.text: For the final 20 minutes start checking the turkey and keep an eye on the temperature to determine when the turkey is done. The recommended internal temperature is 165°-170°F. (This instant read meat thermometer is our favorite - so quick!)
recipeInstructions.name: Test temperature

recipeInstructions.text: Remove the basket from the cooker and let rest for about 15-20 minutes. Remove the turkey from the basket, carve and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: Rest and carve

name: Healthy Air Fryer Herbed Turkey Breast with Lemon Pepper
description: This recipe is based on 3 pound de-boned turkey breasts (or 4 pounds bone-in). Keep the skin-on the turkey because it keeps the meat moist during air frying. Have a kitchen thermometer ready to check  the internal turkey temperature to ensure it’s cooked.

video.name: Air Fryer Turkey Breast with Lemon Pepper or Herbs with Time & Temp.
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fried-turkey-breast/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/39ttOR9 INGREDIENTS 3 pounds de-boned uncooked turkey breast *see recipe head note 2 Tablespoons oil 1 Tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 1 teaspoon lemon pepper or dried herb seasoning 1/2 teaspoon salt , or to taste INSTRUCTIONS 1. Make sure the turkey breast is completely thawed or else it will not cook through. Pat the turkey dry. 2. In a bowl or plastic bag, combine the oil, Worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper or herbs, and salt. Add the turkey to the marinade, making sure the marinade completely coats the turkey breast. If possible, marinate for 1-2 hours. 3. Lightly spray or rub oil the air fryer basket. Remove the turkey from the marinade and place the turkey breast skin-side down in the air fryer basket. 4. Air Fry at 350°F for 25 minutes. Flip the turkey breast to skin side up, and Air Fry for another 25-35 minutes until internal temperature of turkey reaches 165°F in the thickest part. If you’re cooking bone-in turkey breast, cook for additional 5-10 minutes if needed. 5. Allow the breast to rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve while warm. 6. NOTE: To keep turkey breast from drying out (especially if it is skinless), spray the turkey top and edges with a little oil a couple times during cooking to keep it moist. It's like "basting" the turkey breast with oil. This is helpful if you have a bigger breast. 7. NOTE on SIZE: Some breasts are thinner or sometimes broken into several pieces including the tenderloin. If you're cooking separate smaller pieces, then cooking time is much less. If you want a "whole" looking breast when you have multiple pieces, then tie the pieces together with some kitchen string. This will give the breast a whole looking shape. Then marinate the breast according to the instructions. ? recipeIngredient: 3 pounds de-boned uncooked turkey breast (*see recipe head note)
1 teaspoon lemon pepper or dried herb seasoning

recipeInstructions.text: Make sure the turkey breast is completely thawed or else it will not cook through. Pat the turkey dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep turkey breast

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl or plastic bag, combine the oil, Worcestershire sauce, lemon pepper or herbs, and salt. Add the turkey to the marinade, making sure the marinade completely coats the turkey breast. If possible, marinate for 1-2 hours.
recipeInstructions.name: Marinate turkey

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly spray or rub oil the air fryer basket. Remove the turkey from the marinade and place the turkey breast skin-side down in the air fryer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 350°F for 25 minutes. NOTE: To keep turkey breast from drying out (especially if it is skinless), spray the turkey top and edges with a little oil a couple times during cooking to keep it moist. It's like "basting" the turkey breast with oil. This is helpful if you have a bigger breast.
recipeInstructions.name: air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the turkey breast to skin side up, and Air Fry for another 25-35 minutes until internal temperature of turkey reaches 165°F in the thickest part. If you’re cooking bone-in turkey breast, cook for additional 5-10 minutes if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and cook until finished

recipeInstructions.text: Allow the breast to rest for 5 minutes. Slice and serve while warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Carve and serve

name: Frozen Grands Biscuits in Air Fryer
description: Air Fryer cooking times will vary a lot depending on your size and style of air fryer. Timing will also vary depending on the type of frozen biscuits you are cooking. Check the biscuits after the first 6 minutes to make sure it’s cooked to your preferred texture. After cooking in your specific air fryer, you’ll know what time and temp works best for the biscuits. We suggest cooking them slightly “crisper” or more golden brown on on the outside to make sure the biscuits are cooked all the way through. Cook in only a single layer with space between the biscuits. Cook in batches if needed. For subsequent batches, if your air fryer is already heated, the biscuits may cook a few minutes quicker.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket or racks with oil to keep the biscuits from sticking. We don’t suggest using parchment paper underneath because you want maximum air flow under the biscuits to help them cook all the way though. The parchment paper prevents maximum air flow under the biscuits.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray Air Fryer Basket with Oil

recipeInstructions.text: Lay biscuits in single layer of air fryer basket or racks. Make sure to space them out so they aren't touching & have room to rise & expand. Cook in batches if needed.Spray the tops of the biscuits to give them a more golden top when they air fry.
recipeInstructions.name: Lay Biscuits in Single Layer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for 10 minutes. Gently wiggle the biscuits to loosen from the baskets. Flip the biscuits over. Continue to Air Fry at 330°F/165°C for another 8-12 minutes, or until golden and cooked through. If they're still slightly doughy in the middle, leave them in the turned-off air fryer for about 2-3 minutes to continue cooking in the residual heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

If you are using croutons or homemade toasted bread cubes, use 2 cups equal about 6 oz of boxed stuffing mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat medium skillet on medium high-heat. Melt butter and add onions and celery. Cook until onions are soft.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook onions and celery

recipeInstructions.text: Add sausage and break it up into small pieces (a meat chopper makes quick work of this). Stirring occasionally, cook until browned. Add garlic powder, optional herbs, black pepper, salt, and broth (and add any other optional stuffing extras) and then stir. Heat to a low boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook sausage

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from heat. Add stuffing and mix lightly.
recipeInstructions.name: Add stuffing

recipeInstructions.text: Spray oil or brush butter inside of 7” accessory bucket or baking dish.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill prepared 7” accessory bucket or baking dish with stuffing and spread into an even layer. Cover with foil.
recipeInstructions.name: Put in baking dish

recipeInstructions.text: For Oven Style Air Fryers: Place the stuffing dish on lowest rack of the air fryer. For Bucket Style Air Fryers: place the stuffing dish in the air fryer.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 350°F/175°C for 10 minutes, covered with foil. Then remove foil and brush with melted butter. Leave the stuffing uncovered in the air fryer.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry covered

recipeInstructions.text: Continue to Air Fry for another 2-5 minutes or until the top is crisp to your liking. Remove from air fryer and serve warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut and peel butternut squash into bite sized pieces, about 1/2" cubes.

recipeInstructions.text: Whisk together oil, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.  Add butternut squash cubes and toss in marinade to coat all squash pieces.

recipeInstructions.name: Add the squash to air fryer basket (if you have a small air fryer, cook it in two batches). Try to keep the squash in a single layer for more even cooking.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F for 20-24 minutes. After cooking for 10 minutes, shake and turn the squash, then continue cooking for the remaining 10 minutes or until the squash is tender.Serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 380°F for 20-24 minutes. After cooking for 10 minutes, shake and turn the squash, then continue cooking for the remaining 10 minutes or until the squash is tender.Serve warm.

name: Air Fryer Spinach Dip
description: One full batch will fit in a deeper 6.5”x3” baking dish. Find a dip vessel to fit your air fryer basket or rack. If your air fryer is too small or you only have smaller shallow baking dishes, cook the dip in two batches. This-->  handled cake barrel is great because it’s deep enough to fit the whole batch. The deeper the dish, the longer it may take for the dip to cook through. So stirring the dip halfway through helps ensure all the ingredients cook evenly without burning the top crust.

recipeInstructions.text: *see head note about vessel choice*  Spray the baking vessel with cooking spray or olive oil. name: Air Fryer Hot Crab Dip
description: The quality of the crab meat makes all the difference for flavor. Some canned crab is really mushy, while others have big chunks of crab. If using canned crab that's watery, you should consider adding double the crab for more flavor. We love the handled cake barrel because it’s deep enough to fit the whole batch. The deeper the dish, the longer it may take for the dip to cook through. Stirring the dip twice during cooking helps ensure all the ingredients cook evenly without burning the top crust. More info about baking vessels in notes below.

Chips, crackers, bread or for gluten-free serve with vegetables

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the baking dish *see note below* with cooking spray or olive oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray baking dish

recipeInstructions.text: In large bowl, combine cream cheese, lemon juice, onions, green onions, Worcestershire sauce, mayo, parmesan cheese and black pepper. Gently fold in lump crab meat until it's combined into the cheese mixture.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix ingredient together.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the dip mixture into the baking dish. Place at the baking dish into the air fryer basket/tray.
recipeInstructions.name: Add to baking dish

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 300°F/150°C for 20 minutes. After cooking for 20 minutes, stir the dip.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry and stir

recipeInstructions.text: Continue Air Frying at 300°F/150°C for 10 minutes. Stir the dip again.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry and stir

recipeInstructions.text: Increase heat to 340°F/170°C and then continue air frying for 5-10 minutes or until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish air frying

recipeInstructions.text: Top with minced parsley. Allow to cool for at least 10 minutes before serving. Serve with your favorite chips, crackers, bread or vegetables. Add a side of lemon wedges if you want if anyone wants to squeeze fresh juice on their serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Turkey Avocado Burgers
description: Okay, it’s not such a secret anymore but it was when we first started making this years ago. Everyone asked about the wonderful rich and deep umami flavor. They couldn’t believe it when we told them the secret sauce was fish sauce! Don’t be scared of fish sauce. It’s brings a depth of flavor that will keep everyone saying this burger patty is the best they’ve ever had! If fish sauce isn't up your alley, Worcestershire or soy sauce are great substitutes.

video.name: Air Fryer Secret Ingredient Turkey Avocado Burgers

recipeIngredient: 1 Tablespoon Worcestershire (, fish sauce, or soy sauce (fish sauce is our favorite))
1 teaspoon dried herbs ((oregano, thyme, dill, basil, marjoram))
Optional: cheese, radish sprouts, lettuce, tomato, etc.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat air fryer at 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine turkey, garlic, Worcestershire sauce (or fish sauce or soy sauce), dried herbs, onion, salt and pepper. Mix everything until just combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix Patties

recipeInstructions.text: Divide and flatten into 4 patties about 4” wide. Spray both sides with oil. If you have a smaller air fryer, you’ll have to cook in two batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Form Patties

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 10-12 minutes, flip after 6 minutes. Cook to your preference or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F/74°C. If your patty is thicker, you many need to cook for a few more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: For Turkey Cheeseburgers: add the slices of cheese on top of the cooked patties. Air fry at 380°F/193°C for about 30 seconds to 1 minute to melt the cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt Cheese

recipeInstructions.text: For best juiciness, cover the patties and let rest for 3 minutes. Warm the buns in the air fryer at 380°F for about 1 minute while patties are resting. Serve on buns, topped with 1/4 avocado and your favorite burger toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble Burgers

name: Air Fryer Frozen Shrimp (raw & un-breaded)
description: Read First: Lots of factors influence outcome of how frozen shrimp cook. They all vary significantly in size, coating, pre-cooked or raw, so you’ll have to adjust timing. This recipe is for frozen, raw, unbreaded shrimp.All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These recipes were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.Make sure to cook in just a single layer. Cook in multiple batches if needed.

name: Air Fryer Tofu Bites - Crispy!
description: You should use firm or extra firm tofu so it doesn’t break apart. Squeezing out excess water helps the tofu cook crisper.

recipeIngredient: 14 oz. firm or extra firm tofu (, (1 block) drained)
Sauce for dipping: soy sauce (, bbq sauce, teriyaki sauce, chili garlic sauce)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat air fryer at 400°F for 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat

recipeInstructions.text: Gently squeeze or press-out excess water from the tofu block. Cut tofu into 1” cubes.
recipeInstructions.name: Squeeze out Water

recipeInstructions.text: Add tofu cubes to bowl. Spray evenly with oil around all sides. Sprinkle half the amount of spices: lemon pepper, garlic powder, and salt evenly around all the tofu cubes. Gently stir or toss. Repeat with another layer of light oil spray and remainder of spices.
recipeInstructions.name: Season

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F for 10 minutes. Gently flip over the tofu cubes or shake the basket so tofu can tumble and turn.  Continue to Air Fry for another 10 minutes or until golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry and toss

recipeInstructions.text: Check the texture of the tofu. If you want it more crispy, then Air Fry for additional 5-10 minutes OR until the tofu is to your liking. We like our tofu extra crispy with an outside crust so we’ll cook it for an extra 7 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Allow to slightly cool and dip in your favorite sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

name: Air Fryer Cauliflower with Garlic
description: Air fried cauliflower makes a great, quick and easy side dish. Adjust the seasonings to taste, or feel free to add different spices to taste. You can use garlic powder or minced garlic. The minced garlic may brown a bit in the air fryer, but many find it delicious that way. Make sure to gently shake or toss the cauliflower halfway through cooking to help the cauliflower cook evenly.
recipeIngredient: 1  small head cauliflower ((about 1.5 lbs./680g), cut into bite sized pieces)
2 Tablespoons vegetable oil (, or to taste)
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder (, or 3 cloves garlic minced)
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (, or to taste)
1/2 teaspoon black pepper (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Place the cut up cauliflower in a large bowl. In another bowl combine the oil, garlic powder (or minced garlic), salt, and pepper.Alternate seasoning: Don't combine the seasonings. Instead, in the following step, just add the oil and individual seasonings to the caulifower. (Both ways work fine, some cooks like to  combine everythign first, others don't want to dirty an extra bowl. You chose how you like to cook).
recipeInstructions.name: Cut caulifower. Combine seasonings.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour about half of the seasoned marinade over the cauliflower. Toss and then repeat with the remaining seasonings (it helps season the cauliflower more evenly to mix in stages). Continue stirring the cauliflower until it completely soaks up all the marinade (there shouldn't be any marinade pooling at the bottom of the bowl).
recipeInstructions.name: Coat Cauliflower with Seasonings

recipeInstructions.text: Put the cauliflower into air fryer basket and spread evenly in the basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread into Even Layer in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 12-18 minutes, shake or gently turn half way. Cook to your desired tenderness and liking. Season with chopped parsely if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

keywords: Air Fryer, Cauliflower, Garlic

name: Air Fryer Chicken, Broccoli, and Onions
description: DO NOT pre-heat the air fryer for this recipe. The chicken and broccoli will cook down and shrink, so if it the basket feels full at first, there will be less volume after everything is cooked.Two Options for Air Frying Broccoli & Onions: Cooking the chicken halfway, then adding the veggies will cook the broccoli & onions moderately. The other option is to air fry them all together from the beginning which makes the broccoli/onions extra crispy. Or you can add the veggies at anytime that cooks it to your preference. After your first batch, you'll know better what method works for your air fryer and personal liking.
