recipeIngredient: 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast or thighs (, cut into 1-inch bites sized pieces)
1/4-1/2 pound broccoli (, cut into florets (1-2 cups))
3 Tablespoons vegetable oil ( or grape seed oil)
1 Tablespoon soy sauce (, or to taste (use Tamari for Gluten Free))
1 Tablespoon rice vinegar ((use distilled white vinegar for Gluten Free))
1/2 teaspoon sea salt (, or to taste)

recipeInstructions.name: Air Frying Option #1: Regular Cooked Broccoli

itemListElement.text: Make Marinade: In a bowl, combine oil, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, optional hot sauce, salt, and pepper.
itemListElement.name: Make Marinade: In a bowl, combine oil, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, optional hot sauce, salt, and pepper.

itemListElement.text: In bowl add chicken. In a second bowl add broccoli and onions. Divide the marinade between the two bowls, stirring to coat each completely.
itemListElement.name: In bowl add chicken. In a second bowl add broccoli and onions. Divide the marinade between the two bowls, stirring to coat each completely.

itemListElement.text: Air Fry: Add just the chicken to the air fryer basket/tray. Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 10 minutes. Stir in the broccoli and onions with the chicken (make sure to include all the marinade). Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 8-10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Make sure to stir halfway through cooking so broccoli gets cooked evenly.
itemListElement.name: Air Fry: Add just the chicken to the air fryer basket/tray. Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 10 minutes. Stir in the broccoli and onions with the chicken (make sure to include all the marinade). Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for 8-10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Make sure to stir halfway through cooking so broccoli gets cooked evenly.

itemListElement.text: Season with additional salt and pepper, to taste. Add fresh lemon juice on top (optional) and serve warm.
itemListElement.name: Season with additional salt and pepper, to taste. Add fresh lemon juice on top (optional) and serve warm.

recipeInstructions.name: Air Frying Option #2: Extra Crispy, Charred Broccoli

itemListElement.text: Combine chicken, broccoli and onion in bowl. Toss ingredients together.
itemListElement.name: Combine chicken, broccoli and onion in bowl. Toss ingredients together.

itemListElement.text: Make Marinade: In a bowl, combine oil, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, optional hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken, broccoli and onions to the marinade. Stir thoroughly to combine the marinade with chicken, broccoli and onions.
itemListElement.name: Make Marinade: In a bowl, combine oil, garlic powder, ginger, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sesame oil, optional hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken, broccoli and onions to the marinade. Stir thoroughly to combine the marinade with chicken, broccoli and onions.

itemListElement.text: Air Fry: Add ingredients to air fryer basket/tray. Air Fry 380°F/195°C for 16-20 minutes, shaking and gently tossing halfway through cooking. Make sure to toss so that everything cooks evenly. Check chicken to make sure it’s cooked through. If not, cook for additional 3-5 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Air Fry: Add ingredients to air fryer basket/tray. Air Fry 380°F/195°C for 16-20 minutes, shaking and gently tossing halfway through cooking. Make sure to toss so that everything cooks evenly. Check chicken to make sure it’s cooked through. If not, cook for additional 3-5 minutes.

itemListElement.text: If needed, season with additional salt and pepper, to taste. Add fresh lemon juice on top (optional) and serve warm.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash the fresh carrots. Slice the carrots diagonally in 1/2-inch thick slices. Combine the olive oil, herbs, salt & pepper in a bowl. Add the carrots and toss to evenly combine. Place the carrots in the air fryer basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash the fresh carrots. Slice the carrots diagonally in 1/2-inch thick slices. Combine the olive oil, herbs, salt & pepper in a bowl. Add the carrots and toss to evenly combine. Place the carrots in the air fryer basket.

name: Air Fryer Steak Bites & Mushrooms
description: See Notes below recipe for additional Air Fryer cooking tips. And check out the helpful step by step photos on the website write up. For the types of steak, use your favorite. Depending on the budget, we prefer ribeye, sirloin, tri-tip, and chuck shoulder steaks (aka London Broil steaks).

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. steaks (, cut into 1” cubes & patted dry)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine the steak cubes and mushrooms. Make sure they're about the same size for even cooking. Coat with the melted butter and then season with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine the steak cubes and mushrooms. Make sure they're about the same size for even cooking. Coat with the melted butter and then season with Worcestershire sauce, garlic powder, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the steak a good sear.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the Air Fryer at 400°F for 4 minutes. This will give the steak a good sear.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the steak and mushrooms in the air fryer basket or rack and spread it in one even layer. Air fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the steak and mushrooms about 3 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the steak, size of the air fryer).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the steak and mushrooms in the air fryer basket or rack and spread it in one even layer. Air fry at 400°F for 10-18 minutes, shaking and flipping and the steak and mushrooms about 3 times through cooking process (time depends on your preferred doneness, thickness of the steak, size of the air fryer).

recipeInstructions.text: Check the steak to see how well done it is cooked. If you want the steak more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time.
recipeInstructions.name: Check the steak to see how well done it is cooked. If you want the steak more done, add an extra 2-5 minutes of cooking time.

recipeInstructions.text: (optional) Garnish with parsley and drizzle with optional melted butter and/or optional chili flakes.  Season with additional salt & pepper if desired. Serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: (optional) Garnish with parsley and drizzle with optional melted butter and/or optional chili flakes.  Season with additional salt & pepper if desired. Serve warm.

name: Air Fryer Garlic Zucchini
description: The thickness of the cut zucchini slices is the most important for determining cooking time and final texture. We find that cutting the zucchini into 1/2” or slightly thicker gives a great balance between browning the slices and cooking them through to be tender without being overly soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and dry the zucchini. Cut the ends of the zucchini, if desired. Cut the zucchini into 1/2” thick slices (either into lengthwise slices or into coins). If cutting into lengthwise slices, cut to length to fit the width of your air fryer basket if needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Wash and dry the zucchini. Cut the ends of the zucchini, if desired. Cut the zucchini into 1/2” thick slices (either into lengthwise slices or into coins). If cutting into lengthwise slices, cut to length to fit the width of your air fryer basket if needed.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly oil or spray the zucchini slices on both sides and then season with garlic powder, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly oil or spray the zucchini slices on both sides and then season with garlic powder, salt and pepper.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 400°F for 8-14 minutes or until browned and cooked through.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 400°F for 8-14 minutes or until browned and cooked through.

name: Air Fryer Stuffed Mushrooms
description: Air frying is the perfect way to cook stuffed mushrooms, especially for smaller quantities. The air fryer cooks them quickly and gives the mushrooms a perfect texture. If you fill the 8 oz's of mushroom caps full, you won't have much left over. But if you decide to fill the mushrooms with less filling, then you'll have some left over. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These recipes were tested on basket style air fryers.

video.name: Air Fryer Stuffed Mushrooms
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-stuffed-mushrooms/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Cosori Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/3oaErwk Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 8 oz. (227 g) button mushrooms 4 oz. (113 g) cream cheese , softened 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) garlic powder 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) paprika 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) chili powder 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) salt , or more to taste fresh cracked black pepper 1/4 cup (30 g) grated cheese , for topping minced parsley (optional) ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-stuffed-mushrooms/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1/4 teaspoon salt (, or more to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Removed the stems from the mushrooms, then dice the stems and set aside about 1/2 of the diced stems.
recipeInstructions.name: Dice Stems

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl make the filling: mix together the cream cheese, garlic powder, paprika, chili powder, salt and pepper until smooth. Fold in the reserved diced mushroom stems.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Filling

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the mushroom tops with oil spray. Make sure to spray liberally, because if you don't spray the tops of mushrooms enough, they might dry out during air frying.  Fill the cavity of mushroom tops with the cream cheese mixture. Place the mushrooms in the air fryer basket (only place the mushrooms a single layer - if needed cook in multiple batches).
recipeInstructions.name: Stuff Mushrooms

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for 6-8 minutes, depending on the size of the mushrooms.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Top the stuffed mushrooms with grated cheese. Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for another 1-2 minutes, or until the cheese is melted. Let the mushrooms cool slightly then garnish with minced parsley and serve. Serve warm or at room temperature.
recipeInstructions.name: Add Cheese

They all vary in size and sometimes the coating, etc. so you’ll have to adjust timing as needed.Cook in just a single layer. If needed cook in multiple batches. Read our HOW TO tips in the article. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe.

recipeInstructions.text: Place the frozen mozzarella sticks in the air fryer basket and spread out evenly in a single layer. No oil spray is needed.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 5 minutes. Gently shake or turn. Continue to Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for another 1-2 minutes OR until the cheese nearly starts to ooze out.

name: Air Fryer Tortilla Pizzas
description: Flour or corn tortillas will work, but we prefer the texture of the flour much better for the air fryer pizzas. If using corn tortillas, give them a light spray of oil to help them get crispier.Make sure to get a size that isn't larger than your air fryer basket/tray. If needed, you can always cut it down to size.Toppings may fly off the pizzas, depending on how light they are and how strong your air fryer fan is. Use an air fryer rack to keep the toppings from flying off while air frying the pizzas (see photo in recipe steps).

name: Air Fryer Frozen Personal Pizza
description: Lots of factors influence outcome of how the pizza cooks. They all vary in size and thickness, so you’ll have to adjust timing. All air fryers are different sizes and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first pizza, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. These recipes were tested on basket style air fryers. Read more recipe notes below the recipe. Nutrition based on one 9.5 oz Frozen Personal Pepperoni Pizza
recipeIngredient: oil spray (, (optional to lightly coat the pizza))

recipeInstructions.text: Remove pizza from plastic. Place the pizza in the air fryer basket. Lightly spray the top of pizza so that the toppings don't burn.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove pizza from plastic. Place the pizza in the air fryer basket. Lightly spray the top of pizza so that the toppings don't burn.

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for about 6-10 minutes or until cooked to your desired crispness. Start cooking for about 6 minutes first. We like our pizza extra crispy, so we'll start with 8 minutes. Then check to see if it's to your liking. Cook additional minute or two if you want the pizza to be crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry at 380°F/195°C for about 6-10 minutes or until cooked to your desired crispness. Start cooking for about 6 minutes first. recipeInstructions.text: Deep dish crusts will take a little longer, while thin crust will be slightly quicker.
recipeInstructions.name: Deep dish crusts will take a little longer, while thin crust will be slightly quicker.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pizza cool for a few minutes. Enjoy!

name: Air Fryer Potato Chips
description: Should you soak the potato slices in water first to remove the starch? We tested this several times in different air fryers and did not see a difference in results from soaking. In fact, we found that not soaking them in water saved time and it made cooking times quicker. The potato chips were still crunchy and delicious. But some people swear by the soaking method. We added the soaking technique in the recipe too so you can have both options. See more recipe NOTES below.
recipeIngredient: optional: ground cumin (, garlic powder or onion powder or paprika)

recipeInstructions.text: Pre-heat Air Fryer at 340°F/170°C for 5 minutes. Slice potato into 1/8” thin slices. (A mandoline with cut-resistant gloves makes this step quick & even). Discard the small end pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice Potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Optional - Add potato slices to bowl of cold water for at least 20 minutes. Remove potato slices and pat dry with towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak slices

recipeInstructions.text: Place potato slices in a bowl and spray with oil, season with salt, pepper or optional spices. Toss potatoes to evenly coat all sides with the oil and seasonings.
recipeInstructions.name: Season slices

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the air fryer basket/tray with oil to minimize sticking. Lay potato slices in single layer, trying to not overlap slices.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Initial Browning: Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 10 minutes. Flip and separate any touching slices.Continue to Air Fry at 340°F/170°C for 3-5 minutes increments or until they start to crisp on the edges. Separate the potatoes so they don’t stick together and this helps the chips crisp on both sides. Look for crispy brown sides because this is what makes them crunchy. But don’t let them burn. Check out our photos for reference.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry

recipeInstructions.text: Finishing: When you see crisp brown edges, reduce heat to 280°F/140°C and Air Fry for another 2-5 minutes or until they are dry. The chips will become crunchier when they cool.If some of the chips are a still little chewy, then remove the crunchy ones and continue to Air Fry the chewy chips at 280°F/140°C for another 3 minutes or until crispy.
recipeInstructions.name: Finish Air Frying

name: Air Fryer Garlic Herb Salmon
description: One of our favorite ways to prepare salmon is in the air fryer. It cooks perfectly and is always moist on the inside. The garlic herb marinade is so easy and crazy good. It’s a great quick and easy weeknight dinner. Salmon sizes will vary in length, thickness, and fattiness (leaner salmon cooks quicker), so you can add or reduce cooking time if needed to cook the salmon to your preferred texture. You can make this an easy one "pot" meal by cooking our air fryer crispy broccoli, then cook the salmon.
recipeIngredient: 2  salmon fillets ((6 oz./170g each), skin and bones removed)
1 teaspoon dried herbs or 2 teaspoons fresh chopped dill (, thyme or oregano)
1 teaspoon garlic powder ( or 2 small cloves garlic, minced)
olive oil or oil spray (, for coating)

recipeInstructions.text: Prep the salmon: rinse and pat dry the salmon. Lightly coat with oil or oil spray. Season with herbs, garlic powder/minced garlic, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Season salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Lay perforated silicone liner or perforated parchment paper inside basket or spray the bottom of basket. Place salmon in basket.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for about 6-10 minutes. Gently press the salmon to check its doneness (the firmer it is, the more fully cooked it is). Or check the salmon with a fork to make sure it's cooked to your preferred doneness.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Garlic Herb Salmon

recipeIngredient: Kosher salt (, or sea salt, to taste)
1/4 cup corn starch (, or as needed)

recipeInstructions.text: If you have whole wings, separate them into the drum and flat. If needed, pat dry the chicken wings. Season with salt, pepper, and optional garlic powder.
recipeInstructions.name: Season chicken wings

recipeInstructions.text: For oil-free version, place in even layer in air fryer basket/tray. Follow air fry instructions below. For Extra Crispy Crust, follow optional steps for corn starch crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer
For Extra Crispy Corn Starch Crust

itemListElement.text: Add seasoning to the wings then lay them in single layer on a plate or cutting board. Sprinkle cornstarch over the wings on both sides.
itemListElement.name: Season and cornstarch chicken wings

itemListElement.text: Liberally spray wings evenly with oil spray so that all the cornstarch is coated in oil. There should be no dry white clumps of cornstarch or else they will cook hard and dry.
itemListElement.name: Spray with oil

itemListElement.text: Place the coated wings in your air fryer basket or tray/rack.
itemListElement.name: Place in air fryer

itemListElement.text: Air Fry wings at 400°F/205°C for 20 minutes minutes or until cripsy-looking and nearly cooked through.
itemListElement.name: Air fry

itemListElement.text: Flip the wings and Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for additional 5-10 minutes or until wings are fully cooked and crispy.
itemListElement.name: Flip and air fry

itemListElement.text: If desired, sprinkle with salt & pepper or toss /serve with your favorite sauce. Serve warm. For a more caramelized sauce, see next optional step.
itemListElement.name: Serve

itemListElement.text: Optional: If using a sauce, toss with enough sauce to coat the wings, then Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for another 2-3 minutes for caramelize the sauce onto the wings. Serve warm.
itemListElement.name: Cook with sauce

Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-buffalo-wings/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerworld Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: Kosher salt (, or sea salt, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the Buffalo Sauce: Whisk together the buffalo sauce ingredients (melted butter, hot sauce, Worcestershire or soy sauce, and garlic powder). Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Make Buffalo Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: If needed, pat dry the chicken wings. Season the wings with salt, pepper, and optional garlic powder and then add to the air fryer basket/tray in a single layer (cook in batches if needed).
recipeInstructions.name: Season wings

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the Wings at 400°F/205°C for 20-30 minutes, flipping the wings after the first 15 minutes. Cook the wings until crispy and cooked through. Depending on how many much you are cooking and the size of your air fryer, the wings might need to be tossed a third time while cooking so the air fry evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry wings

recipeInstructions.text: Optional: For a little more flavor, brush a little sauce on wings about 2 minutes before they are finished cooking.  Continue to air fry for another 1-2 minutes with the sauce. Make sure not to air fry the sauced wings too long or else the sauce will burn. You’ll be adding more sauce on before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry with sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Sauce the Wings Before Serving: allow the wings to cool for a couple minutes, then toss them with the homemade buffalo sauce. The sauce will cling less to super hot wings because the hot wings melt the butter. So if the wings are slightly cooler, the homemade sauce will cling more. If you’re using bottled sauce, then you can coat the super hot wings and the sauce will still stick. Sauce and serve warm.
recipeInstructions.name: Toss wings with sauce

name: Air Fryer “Shake ’n Bake" Style Pork Chops
description:
Different cuts and thicknesses of pork. This factor will determine your final cooking time. So you'll have to adjust the timing accordingly when you make your first batch. After that, you'll know what your preferred timing is based on your specific cut of pork chops and size of air fryer. 

Most of the shake and bake style seasoned breading mixes say to moisten the chicken. The boxes often will suggest ice water, egg, &/or milk. We added the mayo part because it's a nice option for extra moist chicken. And it also helps the breading stick better.

recipeIngredient: Ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo (, to moisten the pork)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat Air Fryer at 380°F/195°C for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Moisten the pork chops based on seasoned coating mix instructions (or by using ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo). Coat with the seasoned coating mix.

name: Air Fryer Scalloped Potatoes
description: Our cheesy scalloped potatoes are wonderful to serve 3-4 people. After numerous tests we’ve perfected this popular potato recipe in the air fryer. The secret is cooking the potatoes first then adding the cream mixture. This ensures that the potatoes are tender, creamy and cheesy. Do not use red potatoes! Use russet or gold potatoes or similar for a more the best texture.  (This recipe is for a 6 qt. bucket style air fryer using the 7” accessory bucket cake pan with handles)

video.name: Air Fryer Scalloped Potatoes
video.description: Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-scalloped-potatoes/ ——— TOOLS USED IN THIS RECIPE VIDEO ———— Get the Gourmia Air Fryer: https://amzn.to/36nP4py Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv or https://amzn.to/39tvt9l Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs INGREDIENTS 1 lb. (454 g) potatoes , washed and dried (about 3 medium potatoes) oil spray 3/4 cup (180 ml) heavy cream 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) salt , or to taste 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) garlic powder 1/4 teaspoon (1.25 ml) black pepper 1/2 cup (57 g) shredded cheddar cheese ? Print Full Recipe Here ? https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-scalloped-potatoes/ ? ?—— OUR ULTIMATE KITCHEN FAVORITES——?? ?Get the Best Oil Sprayer: https://amzn.to/2NY3BSs ?Get the Perforated Parchment Sheets: https://amzn.to/33sEV9a ?Get the Air Fryer Accessory Kit (choose right size for your air fryer): https://amzn.to/39GBIqv & https://amzn.to/39tvt9l ?Get the Air Fryer Silicone Pot: https://amzn.to/2JWeAco ?Get the Silicone Baking Cups: https://amzn.to/39KFjDD ?Get the OXO Silicone Tools: https://amzn.to/2JZg8lS SOCIAL MEDIA: Join our Food Community: Subscribe to Our YouTube Videos: https://www.youtube.com/airfryerworld?sub_confirmation=1 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theairfryerclub/ Facebook Group for Help & Tips https://www.facebook.com/groups/AirFryerRecipesClub Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/AirFryerWorld/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/airfryerworld Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/AirFryerWorld/

recipeIngredient: 1 lb. potatoes (, washed and dried (about 3 medium potatoes))

recipeInstructions.text: Peel and slice potatoes thin and spray oil evenly over the potatoes.
recipeInstructions.name: Peel & slice potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Spray the inside bottom and sides of the 7-inch accessory bucket cake pan with oil. Lay the potato slices in a neat stack with their edges aligned vertically into the prepared bucket pan. Fan the potatoes out if there is room after they are in the bucket pan. Place the the pan into the Air Fryer.
recipeInstructions.name: Put potatoes in pan

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/180°C for an initial 18 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: While potatoes are air frying make the cream mixture: combine heavy cream, salt, garlic powder and black pepper. Stir until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Make sauce

recipeInstructions.text: After the potatoes have air fried for the initial 18 minutes, pour the cream mixture over the potatoes. Spread cream over potatoes and gently press the potatoes down to help them settle into the cream.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sauce to potatoes

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry the potatoes again with the cream mixture at reduced temperature of 300°F/150°C for 15-18 minutes, or until potatoes are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the potatoes. Air Fry at 300°F/150°C for additional 1-2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Allow potatoes to cool for 10 minutes before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cheese

keywords: Air Fryer, Scalloped Potatoes

description: Wing sizes vary in size and thickness, so cooking times will vary. For that size of air fryer, 2 lbs. is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. For best results and even cooking, only air fry as many wings that will fit in a single layer.

recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese (, or as needed)
oil spray (, to coat the wings)

recipeInstructions.text: Pat the chicken wings dry in needed. Season with salt, pepper, and optional garlic powder.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the beaten egg in one bowl and the grated parmesan in another. Dip the wings in the beaten egg, shaking off excess egg from the chicken wing.

recipeInstructions.text: Dip the coated wings in the parmesan, turning to coat completely. Repeat with the remaining wings.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the wings hot with any desired sauces for dipping.

name: Air Fryer “Shake ’n Bake” Style Fish
description: The boxes say to moisten the fish fillets first and we added more options to do this: ice water, milk, egg or mayo.Lots of factors influence how the fish fillets cook. They all vary in size and thickness, so you’ll have to adjust timing. All air fryers are different and some cook much hotter than others. Once you cook your first batch, you’ll know more of what works for your model of air fryer and size of food. Make sure to spray the filets to completely coat all the dry spots of breading or else it may cook up dry and crunchy instead of crispy. Want to know what oils and sprayers are best for an air fryer? This article is a great write up.
recipeIngredient: 1 lb. white fish fillets ((cod, halibut, tilapia, etc.))
Ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo (, to moisten the fish)
1 cup Shake ’n Bake Style Seasoned Coating Mix ((approximately))
Oil spray (, to coat the fish)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat Air Fryer at 380°F/195°C for 4 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat Air Fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Cut fish fillets in half if needed. Make sure they are even sized so they’ll cook evenly. (The thicker they are, the longer they will take to cook).  Moisten the fish based on seasoned coating instructions (or by using ice water, beaten egg, milk, or mayo). Coat with the seasoned coating mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Coat Fish

recipeInstructions.text: Spray air fryer basket/tray with oil or place a perforated parchment sheet in the air fryer basket/tray & lightly coat with oil spray (this helps keep the seasoned coating from sticking to the surface & coming off).
recipeInstructions.name: Spray & Line Air Fryer Basket

recipeInstructions.text: Place the coated fish in a single layer (cook in batches if needed). Make sure the fish is not touching or the coating may flake off when you flip them. Lightly coat with oil spray.
recipeInstructions.name: Place Fish in air fryer

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 380°F/193°C for 8-14 minutes, depending on the size and thickness of your fillets. After 6 minutes, flip the filets. Lightly spray any dry spots than then continue cooking for the remaining time or until they are crispy brown and the fish is cooked through. Serve with your favorite dip: tartar sauce, mustard, aioli, etc.
recipeInstructions.name: Air Fry Fish

keywords: Air Fryer, Breaded, Fish, Seafood, Shake N Bake

name: Air Fryer Stuffed Peppers with Taco Meat
description: All of our taste testers love these easy stuffed peppers! The air fryer cooks and crisps the meat and peppers wonderfully. It’s so easy to enjoy these for a quick dinner. We love it with different types of cheese like a mix of pepper jack and parmesan.

video.name: Air Fryer Taco Stuffed Peppers
video.description: Find the complete recipe & more info at: https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-stuffed-peppers/

recipeIngredient: 1/2 pound ground beef, pork, chicken or turkey
1/4 teaspoon black pepper (, or to taste)
olive oil or oil spray (, for coating)
green onions, salsa, guacamole, sour cream

recipeInstructions.text: In bowl, combine meat, tomato sauce, 1/2 cup cheese, chili powder, garlic powder, ground cumin, dried oregano, salt and pepper.
recipeInstructions.name: Combine meat filling

recipeInstructions.text: Cut bell peppers lengthwise and remove seeds.
recipeInstructions.name: Halve and seed bell peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Flip the bell peppers over and spray/brush outside of bell peppers with oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil bell peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Stuff the pepper halves with the meat mixture. Spray tops of meat and peppers. Lay stuffed peppers inside air fryer basket/tray. If you have a small basket, you may have to cook in 2 batches.
recipeInstructions.name: Stuff peppers

recipeInstructions.text: Air Fry at 360°F/182°C for 12-16 minutes or until meat is cooked completely. Top the meat with remainder of cheese and cook one more minute to melt cheese.
recipeInstructions.name: Air fry

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with your favorite toppings.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve

keywords: Air Fried, Air Fry, Air Fryer, Bell Peppers, Stuffed Peppers, Taco Meat

name: Air Fryer Chili Crisp Crunch Chicken Wings
description: The spiciness of the chili crisp/crunch will vary greatly, depending on which brand you use, or if using a homemade one. Some are barely spicy, while others are intense. Adjust the amount to your preference. Our preferred brand is the S&B Crunchy Garlic with Chili Oil. It has a great texture and savory flavor with just a touch of heat and touch of sweet. Wing sizes vary in size and thickness, so cooking times will vary. Some brands of Air Fryers will cook slower or faster than others, adjust accordingly.For 3-4 quart air fryers, 2 lbs. is about the max without overcrowding the air fryer. If you have a larger size of air fryer, you can cook larger batches, but don't overstuff it or else they won't cook evenly. (optional) We have an extra crispy corn starch crust option for you too, but it does require oil spray.

video.name: Air Fryer Chili Crunch Chicken Wings
video.description: Find the complete recipe & more info at: https://airfryerworld.com/air-fryer-chili-crunch-chicken-wings/

recipeIngredient: Kosher salt (, or sea salt, to taste)
1/4 cup chili crisp crunch (, or to taste)
1/4 cup corn starch (, or as needed)

recipeInstructions.text: If you have whole wings, separate them into the drum and flat. If needed, pat dry the chicken wings. Season with salt, pepper, and optional garlic powder.
recipeInstructions.name: Season chicken wings

recipeInstructions.text: For oil-free version, place in even layer in air fryer basket/tray. Follow air fry instructions below. For Extra Crispy Crust, follow optional steps for corn starch crust.
recipeInstructions.name: Place in air fryer
For Extra Crispy Corn Starch Crust

itemListElement.text: Add seasoning to the wings then lay them in single layer on a plate or cutting board. Sprinkle cornstarch over the wings on both sides.
itemListElement.name: Season and cornstarch chicken wings

itemListElement.text: Liberally spray wings evenly with oil spray so that all the cornstarch is coated in oil. There should be no dry white clumps of cornstarch or else they will cook hard and dry.
itemListElement.name: Spray with oil

itemListElement.text: Place the coated wings in your air fryer basket or tray/rack.
itemListElement.name: Place in air fryer

itemListElement.text: Air Fry wings at 400°F/205°C for 20 minutes minutes or until crispy-looking and nearly cooked through.
itemListElement.name: Air fry

itemListElement.text: Flip the wings and Air Fry at 400°F/205°C for additional 5-10 minutes or until wings are fully cooked and crispy.
itemListElement.name: Flip and air fry

itemListElement.text: Toss with the chili crisp/crunch to taste. Spiciness will vary greatly on the brand of chili crisp/crunch, as well has how much you use on the wings. Adjust to your preference.
itemListElement.name: Toss with chili crisp/crunch

keywords: Air Fryer, Chicken Wings, Chili Crisp, Chili Crunch, Crunchy Garlic Chili Crisp
